fields.name: Burning Touch
fields.desc: When the abominable beauty hits with a Slam attack, the Slam deals an extra 21 (6d6) fire damage (included in the attack). In addition, a creature that touches the abominable beauty or hits her with a melee weapon attack while within 5 feet of her takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Cursed Existence
fields.desc: When it drops to 0 hp in desert terrain, the accursed defiler’s body disintegrates into sand and a parched breeze. However, unless it was killed in a hallowed location, with radiant damage, or by a creature under the effects of the bless spell, the accursed defiler reforms at the next sundown 1d100 miles away from where it died in a random direction.

fields.name: Sand Shroud
fields.desc: A miniature sandstorm constantly whirls around the accursed defiler in a 10-foot radius. This area is lightly obscured to creatures other than the accursed defiler. Wisdom (Survival) checks made to follow tracks left by the accursed defiler or other creatures that were traveling in its sand shroud are made with disadvantage.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The accursed defiler doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Darkness Aura
fields.desc: The cave dragon emits magical darkness in a 30-foot radius around it. The darkness moves with the dragon and spreads around corners. Darkvision can’t penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled. At the start of each of its turns, the dragon chooses whether this aura is active. A successful dispel magic (DC 14) cast on the dragon suppresses this aura for 1 minute.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magical Tunneler
fields.desc: The cave dragon can burrow through nonmagical unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dragon can choose whether to leave the material it moves through undisturbed or leave a 10-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: Spiked Climb
fields.desc: The dragon uses its spikes to hold itself in place while climbing, allowing it to climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. If it climbs upside down on a ceiling or suspends itself on a vertical surface while leaving its claws free, it can’t use the Ruff Spikes reaction.

fields.name: Fire Incarnate
fields.desc: Creatures with resistance to fire damage don’t have resistance to the fire damage dealt by the flame dragon. A creature with immunity to fire damage is still immune to the dragon’s fire damage.

fields.name: Heated Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the flame dragon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Mithral Scales
fields.desc: If the dragon rolls a 20 on a saving throw against a spell that targets only it, the dragon is unaffected, and the spell is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the dragon, turning the caster into the target.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Chill of the Void
fields.desc: Creatures with resistance to cold damage don’t have resistance to the cold damage dealt by the Void dragon. A creature with immunity to cold damage is still immune to the dragon’s cold damage.

fields.name: Expert Void Traveler
fields.desc: The Void dragon doesn’t require air, food, drink, sleep, or ambient pressure. While traveling in the Void, the dragon magically glides on solar winds, covering immense distances in short times.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Freedom of Movement
fields.desc: The dragon ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can’t reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Storm Sight
fields.desc: The dragon can see through areas obscured by fog, mist, clouds, or precipitation.

fields.name: Whirling Winds
fields.desc: Gale force winds rage around the dragon’s body. Ranged weapon attack rolls against the dragon have disadvantage.

fields.name: Cloak of Swarms
fields.desc: Akyishigal emits a cloud of flying, stinging insects from his mouth, eyes, and tears in his skin that spreads out in a 5-foot radius from him. At the start of each of his turns, Akyishigal chooses whether this cloak is active.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If Akyishigal fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: Akyishigal has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Air Hatred
fields.desc: The al-aeshma has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are flying.

fields.name: Earth Bound
fields.desc: The al-aeshma is anchored to the earth and can’t fly far from it. The al-aeshma can’t willingly fly more than 30 feet above the ground. If it starts its turn more than 30 feet away from the ground, it loses its damage immunities and is vulnerable to lightning and thunder damage until it starts its turn within 30 feet of the ground.

fields.name: Elemental Demise
fields.desc: When an al-aeshma dies, its body disintegrates into a swirling spray of coarse sand, leaving behind only equipment it was wearing or carrying.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The al-aeshma regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If it takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the al-Aeshma’s next turn. The al-aeshma dies only if it starts its turn at 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The ala doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Poisonous Flesh
fields.desc: The ala’s poison infuses its flesh. A creature that touches the ala or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) poison damage.

fields.name: Storm’s Strength
fields.desc: If the ala is outside and an electrical storm is within 1 mile of it, creatures have disadvantage on their saving throws against the ala’s Lightning’s Kiss.

fields.name: Apothecary
fields.desc: At the start of each of the kobold alchemist’s turns, the alchemist chooses one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. The alchemist has resistance to that damage type until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The algorith doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The algorith is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Woodfriend
fields.desc: When in a forest, the alseid leaves no tracks and automatically discerns true north.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The amphiptere doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Swarming
fields.desc: Up to two amphipteres can share the same space at the same time. The amphiptere has advantage on melee attack rolls if it is sharing its space with another amphiptere that isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Darkness Aura
fields.desc: The cave dragon emits magical darkness in a 30-foot radius around it. The darkness moves with the dragon and spreads around corners. Darkvision can’t penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 4th level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled. At the start of each of its turns, the dragon chooses whether this aura is active. A successful dispel magic (DC 15) cast on the dragon suppresses this aura for 1 minute.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magical Tunneler
fields.desc: The cave dragon can burrow through any unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dragon can choose whether to leave the material it moves through undisturbed or leave a 15-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: Spiked Climb
fields.desc: The dragon uses its spikes to hold itself in place while climbing, allowing it to climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. If it climbs upside down on a ceiling or suspends itself on a vertical surface while leaving its claws free, it can’t use the Ruff Spikes reaction.

fields.name: Fire Incarnate
fields.desc: Creatures with resistance to fire damage don’t have resistance to the fire damage dealt by the flame dragon. A creature with immunity to fire damage is still immune to the dragon’s fire damage.

fields.name: Heated Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the flame dragon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 14 (4d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Mithral Scales
fields.desc: If the dragon succeeds on a saving throw by 5 or more against a spell that targets only it, the dragon is unaffected, and the spell is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the dragon, turning the caster into the target.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The ancient titan can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The ancient titan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Chill of the Void
fields.desc: Creatures with resistance to cold damage don’t have resistance to the cold damage dealt by the Void dragon. A creature with immunity to cold damage is still immune to the dragon’s cold damage.

fields.name: Collapsing Star
fields.desc: When the void dragon dies, it explodes in a swath of celestial destruction. Each creature within 1,000 feet of the dragon must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) bludgeoning damage and 55 (10d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried take half the bludgeoning damage. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is ejected to a random location on a random plane of existence or 5d100 miles away from its current location in a random direction (GM’s choice).

fields.name: Expert Void Traveler
fields.desc: The Void dragon doesn’t require air, food, drink, sleep, or ambient pressure. While traveling in the Void, the dragon magically glides on solar winds, covering immense distances in short times.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Freedom of Movement
fields.desc: The dragon ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can’t reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Storm Sight
fields.desc: The dragon can see through areas obscured by fog, mist, clouds, or precipitation.

fields.name: Whirling Winds
fields.desc: Gale force winds rage around the dragon’s body. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at the dragon are deflected upward and automatically miss. Boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.

fields.name: Agonizing Gaze
fields.desc: When a creature that can see the angatra’s eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the angatra, the angatra can force it to make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw if the angatra isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. On a failed saving throw, the creature’s pain threshold lowers, and it becomes vulnerable to all damage types until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Ancestral Wrath
fields.desc: The angatra immediately recognizes any individual descended from its tribe. It has advantage on attack rolls against such creatures, and those creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the angatra’s traits and attacks.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The angatra doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Keen Touch
fields.desc: The angler worm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on vibrations.

fields.name: Snare Walker
fields.desc: The angler worm ignores movement restrictions caused by its snares or the snares of other angler worms.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The angler worm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Transparent Trap
fields.desc: With 10 minutes of work, the angler worm can create a web of nearly transparent snares in a 20-foot cube. The web must be anchored between two solid masses or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling. A web of snares layered over a flat surface has a depth of 5 feet. The web is difficult terrain, and the snares forming it are nearly transparent, requiring a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice them.

fields.name: Deep Earth Dweller
fields.desc: The annelidast doesn’t require air.

fields.name: Primordial Aura
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the annelidast must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) poison damage. A creature that finishes a long rest within 1,000 feet of the annelidast must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or develop tumors across its body and become poisoned until the tumors are removed by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

fields.name: Tunneler
fields.desc: The annelidast can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The anubian doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Sand Camouflage
fields.desc: The anubian has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

fields.name: Sand Form
fields.desc: The anubian can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Vulnerability to Water
fields.desc: For every 5 feet the anubian moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 2 (1d4) cold damage. An anubian completely immersed in water takes 10 (4d4) cold damage at the start of its turn.

fields.name: Diseased Ichor
fields.desc: When the apau perape takes piercing damage or slashing damage, a spray of caustic blood spurts from the wound. Each creature within 5 feet of the apau perape must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become infected with the Mechuiti’s ichor disease and be poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hp maximum by 5 (2d4) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hp maximum to 0.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The apau perape has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Boscage Brachiation
fields.desc: The arboreal grappler doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it climbs out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Mobile Grappler
fields.desc: The arboreal grappler can move at its full speed when dragging a Medium or smaller creature it has grappled.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The arboreal grappler can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The aridni doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The aridni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The arx is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The arx has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Spiky Hide
fields.desc: A creature that touches the arx or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) piercing damage. This trait also applies to the arx’s walls.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The asanbosam can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Firesight
fields.desc: The ash drake can see through areas obscured by fire, smoke, and fog without penalty.

fields.name: Breath Born
fields.desc: The ashwalker has immunity to a type of damage based on the type of dragon that killed it: acid (black, copper), cold (silver, white), fire (brass, gold, red), lightning (blue, bronze), or poison (green).

fields.name: Burst of Breath
fields.desc: A creature that touches the ashwalker or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) damage of the type noted in its Breath Born trait.

fields.name: Last Breath
fields.desc: The first time the ashwalker is reduced to 0 hp, it drops to 1 hp instead and its Draconic Breath automatically recharges. The ashwalker transforms into raw energy of the type noted in its Breath Born trait. While in this energy form, it is immune to all damage and to being grappled or restrained. At the end of the ashwalker’s next turn, it is destroyed.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The ashwalker doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the devil’s darkvision.

fields.name: Fear Aura
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the automata devil must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the automata devil’s Fear Aura for 24 hours.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The automata devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Contagious Lightning
fields.desc: A creature that touches the azza gremlin or hits it with a metal weapon while within 5 feet of it receives a discharge of lightning. The creature must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or attract lightning for 1 minute. For the duration, attacks that deal lightning damage have advantage against the affected creature, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal lightning damage, and if the creature takes lightning damage, it is paralyzed until the end of its next turn. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

fields.name: Enchanted Weapons
fields.desc: The horseman’s weapon attacks are magical. When the horseman hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 damage of a type depending on the horseman: cold (black night), fire (red sun), radiant (bright day).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The horseman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Peerless Rider
fields.desc: Any attacks directed at the horseman’s mount target the horseman instead, and the horseman confers his damage resistances and immunities and his condition immunities to his mount. In addition, if the horseman and mount are subjected to an effect that allows each to make a saving throw to take only half damage, the mount takes no damage if the horseman succeeds on the saving throw.

fields.name: Timeless Nature
fields.desc: The horseman doesn’t age and doesn’t require food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Brute
fields.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bandit lord hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The bandit lord has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the bandit lord’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The temple cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Priestly Purr
fields.desc: When a cleric or paladin who worships Bastet spends an hour preparing spells while a Bastet temple cat is within 5 feet of it, that spellcaster can choose two 1st-level spells and one 2nd-level spell that it is able to cast and imbue the temple cat with the spells. The spellcaster doesn’t expend spell slots to imbue the cat in this way. The cat can be imbued with no more than three spells at a time. The cat can use the Spellcasting action to cast each spell once, requiring no material components. Once the spells are expended, the temple cat must finish a long rest before it can be imbued with spells again.

fields.name: Honeyed Weapons
fields.desc: Radiant, magical honey drips from the Bear King’s paws and coats his weapons, making his weapon attacks magical. When the Bear King hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The Bear King has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the Bear King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Regeneration (Bear or Hybrid Form only)
fields.desc: The Bear King regains 10 hp at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hp.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The bearfolk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: The ghoul requires no air or sleep.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The beggar ghoul has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the beggar ghoul’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Savage Hunger
fields.desc: Its Bite attack is a critical hit if the beggar ghoul bites a creature it has surprised.

fields.name: Angry Defiance
fields.desc: The vengeful spirit adds its Charisma modifier to its AC (included above).

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The vengeful spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The vengeful spirit doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Arctic Hunter
fields.desc: The beli has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain. In addition, it has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight in snowy terrain.

fields.name: Cold Regeneration
fields.desc: If it starts its turn in an area with below freezing temperature, the beli regains 3 hp. If the beli takes fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the beli’s next turn. The beli dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and it doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The beli doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Foul Form
fields.desc: The bereginyas’s semi-solid form emits poisonous gases. Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the bereginyas must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw by 5 or more is immune to the bereginyas’s Foul Form for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: False Presence
fields.desc: The berstuc detects as a Fey when sensed by spells and features, such as the detect evil and good spell or a paladin’s Divine Sense. However, it is still a Fiend and can be subjected to spells and features that affect Fiends, such as Divine Smite. Beasts and Plants find the berstuc’s presence soothing and don’t attack the berstuc unless ordered to or provoked.

fields.name: Forest Camouflage
fields.desc: The berstuc has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in forest terrain.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The berstuc has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Twisted Path
fields.desc: While in a nonmagical forest, the berstuc leaves no trail and can’t be tracked, except by magical means. Creatures of the berstuc’s choice within 30 feet of it that travel with it can’t retrace their own trails, and become hopelessly lost after 1 hour of travel with the berstuc. Creatures led astray by the berstuc have disadvantage on ability checks to discern their location or to navigate for 24 hours.

fields.name: Verdant Nature
fields.desc: The berstuc doesn’t require food or sleep.

fields.name: Hateful Presence
fields.desc: Each friendly creature within 10 feet of the black knight commander gains a +2 bonus on weapon damage rolls but can’t use the Help action.

fields.name: Locked Saddle
fields.desc: The black knight commander can’t be knocked prone, dismounted, or moved against its will while mounted.

fields.name: Mounted Charge
fields.desc: If the black knight commander moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature while mounted and then hits it with a Lance attack on the same turn, the commander can use a bonus action to command its mount to make one melee weapon attack against that creature as a reaction.

fields.name: Mounted Warrior
fields.desc: The black knight commander is rarely seen without its warhorse mount. The warhorse wears custom barding that raises is Armor Class to 15, and mounting and dismounting the warhorse costs the commander only 5 feet of movement. While the commander is mounted, its mount can’t be charmed or frightened.

fields.name: Carnivorous Compulsion
fields.desc: At the start of each of its turns, if the blemmyes can see an incapacitated creature, the blemmyes must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or spend its next turn moving toward and attacking that creature.

fields.name: Blood Sense
fields.desc: The blood hag can pinpoint the location of creatures that aren’t Constructs or Undead within 60 feet of her and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of her.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The boloti can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Water Camouflage
fields.desc: The boloti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide while at least half of its body is submerged in water.

fields.name: Water Mastery
fields.desc: A boloti has advantage on attack rolls if both it and its target are touching the same body of water. If the target and the boloti are both on dry ground, the boloti has disadvantage on attack rolls.

fields.name: Watery Body (Vortex Form Only)
fields.desc: The boloti can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that starts its turn in the boloti’s space must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or take 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage as it is buffeted by the swirl of water.

fields.name: Collective Mind
fields.desc: The collective’s individual bones are connected via a hive mind. It can telepathically communicate with any of its individual bones within 50 miles of it, and it can’t be surprised. If the collective is reduced to half its hp or fewer, its Intelligence score is reduced to 1, it can’t cast spells, it immediately changes to its shapeless form, and it can’t take on a Humanoid form.

fields.name: Grasping Limbs (Humanoid Form Only)
fields.desc: The bone collective can wield weapons and hold, grasp, push, pull, or interact with objects that might otherwise require a Humanoid form to accomplish.

fields.name: Swarm (Shapeless Form Only)
fields.desc: The bone collective can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bone.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The bone collective doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Wyrmblood Venom
fields.desc: When the bone collective hits a poisoned creature with a Bite or Piercing Bones attack, the target’s Charisma score is reduced by 1d4. The target is incapacitated if this reduces its Charisma to 0. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The bone crab can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Bone Camouflage
fields.desc: The bone crab has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide among bones.

fields.name: Limited Telepathy
fields.desc: The bone crab can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with other bone crabs in its pack within 100 feet of it. While within 30 feet of another bone crab, the bone crab can’t be surprised and has advantage on initiative rolls.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The bone crab has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the crab’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The bone crab’s long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: White Ghost Shivers
fields.desc: A creature that eats the meat of the bone crab or that is bitten by a creature infected with the white ghost shivers disease must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become infected with the disease. An infected creature develops the first symptoms after 24 hours. Symptoms include a mild chill that escalates to a fever and frightful hallucinations that give the disease its name. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion. The exhaustion lasts until the creature finishes a long rest after the disease is cured. A creature that succeeds on two saving throws against the disease recovers from it. Alternatively, the disease can be removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny human skull. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The bone swarm doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Amorphous (Dust Form Only)
fields.desc: The bonepowder ghoul can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: The ghoul requires no air or sleep.

fields.name: Turning Defiance
fields.desc: The bonepowder ghoul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

fields.name: Sense Consecrated
fields.desc: The bouda can pinpoint, by scent, the location of celestials, consecrated places or objects, and creatures wielding divine or celestial power, such as clerics, paladins, or aasimars, within 60 feet of it.

fields.name: Sense Magic
fields.desc: The bouda senses magic within 30 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn’t itself magical.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The broodiken doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The broodiken is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The broodiken has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Shared Rage
fields.desc: The broodiken can’t speak with its creator telepathically, but it can magically receive simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically from its creator while within 100 feet of its creator. The creator can send the broodiken an image of a creature and emotion or simple idea tied to it, such as anger or retrieval, and the broodiken will seek the creature to carry out the emotion or desire. As long as the broodiken is following such an order, it can be more than 100 feet away from its master without wailing.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The bucca doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
fields.desc: The bucca takes 1 radiant damage each minute it is exposed to sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

fields.name: Treasure Sense
fields.desc: The bucca can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 feet of it.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The bukavac can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: A bukavac’s long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Angelic Weapons
fields.desc: The buraq’s attacks are magical. When the buraq hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The buraq has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Night Journey
fields.desc: When outdoors at night, the distance of the buraq’s vision is not limited by nonmagical darkness. Once per month, the buraq can declare it is on a night journey, and for the next 24 hours, it can Teleport as a bonus action. When on a night journey, the buraq can teleport as often as it wants, and its destination must always be in an area of nonmagical darkness within its line of sight. At any point during the night journey, the buraq can use a bonus action to return itself and its rider to the location where it began the night journey.

fields.name: Powerful Steed
fields.desc: The buraq is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity and its ability to carry a rider.

fields.name: Burrow Awareness
fields.desc: A burrowling has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks if at least one other burrowling within 10 feet of it isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The burrowling has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the burrowling’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Heated Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches Camazotz or hits him with a melee attack while within 5 feet of him takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Keen Hearing
fields.desc: Camazotz has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If Camazotz fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: Camazotz has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Straddler
fields.desc: The caustic charger can end its move in the space of a prone Large or smaller creature. A creature standing up from prone in the same space as the charger can move to a space within 5 feet of the charger as part of standing up.

fields.name: Wastes Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of rocks or sand doesn’t cost the caustic charger extra movement.

fields.name: Darkness Shroud
fields.desc: The cave dragon naturally suppresses light near it. Bright light within 15 feet of the dragon becomes dim light, and dim light within 15 feet becomes nonmagical darkness.

fields.name: Magical Tunneler
fields.desc: The cave dragon can burrow through nonmagical unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dragon can choose whether to leave the material it moves through undisturbed or leave a 5-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: Variable Illumination
fields.desc: The cavelight moss sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The moss can alter the radius as a bonus action.

fields.name: Immortal Nature
fields.desc: The chained angel doesn’t require food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The chained angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Redemption
fields.desc: When a creature casts the knock spell on the chained angel’s chains, the chains release a blast of unholy flame. The spellcaster must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage and 16 (3d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the spellcaster survives, the chained angel must immediately make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the angel’s chains fall away. It is restored to its senses and the form it had before it was chained, typically a deva. On a failure, the chained angel remains chained for 7 days, and during that time, any further attempts to cast knock on the angel’s chains fail.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The chelicerae has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The chelicerae can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Brute
fields.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the chieftain hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Chieftain’s Presence
fields.desc: Dragons and kobolds within 30 feet of the chieftain can’t be charmed or frightened.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The kobold chieftain has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the chieftain’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold chieftain has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the chort devil’s darkvision.

fields.name: Hellish Weapons
fields.desc: The chort devil’s weapon attacks are magical. When the devil hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d6 fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The chort devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The chronalmental doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Temporal Body
fields.desc: When a chronalmental is subjected to a slow spell, haste spell, or similar effect, it automatically succeeds on any saving throws required by the spell or effect and regains 13 (3d8) hp.

fields.name: Limited Telepathy
fields.desc: The cikavak can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature that touches it and that can understand a language.

fields.name: Speak with Beasts
fields.desc: The cikavak can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the citrullus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal melon plant.

fields.name: Gush
fields.desc: When the citrullus takes bludgeoning damage, sticky juice splashes out of it. If the attacker is within 30 feet of the citrullus, the attacker must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained by the sticky juice as if it had failed a saving throw against the plant’s Bile Spray action.

fields.name: Point Blank Fencer
fields.desc: A rapier deals one extra die of its damage when the city watch captain hits with it (included in the attack). In addition, the captain ignores the loading property of crossbows and doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll with a crossbow from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature. The captain may still have disadvantage on such an attack from other sources.

fields.name: Tactical Insight
fields.desc: The city watch captain has advantage on initiative rolls, and friendly creatures within 30 feet of the captain and under the captain’s command can choose to take the captain’s initiative instead of their own when combat starts.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The clockwork abomination doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Explosive Infernal Power Source
fields.desc: When a clockwork abomination is destroyed, its infernal battery explodes. Each creature within 10 feet of the abomination must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The clockwork abomination is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The clockwork abomination has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Unstoppable
fields.desc: Moving through difficult terrain doesn’t cost the clockwork abomination extra movement, and its speed can’t be reduced.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The swarm doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The swarm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and it can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny Construct. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The clockwork beetle doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The clockwork beetle is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Limited Telepathy
fields.desc: The clockwork beetle can magically transmit simple messages and images to its owner, provided the owner is within 100 feet of it.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The clockwork beetle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The clockwork hound doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Diligent Tracker
fields.desc: The clockwork hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Survival) checks that rely on scent or that are made to find a creature.

fields.name: Explosive Core
fields.desc: The mechanism that powers the hound explodes when the Construct is destroyed. Each creature within 5 feet of the hound when it is destroyed must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The clockwork hound is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The clockwork hound has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The clockwork huntsman doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Explosive Core
fields.desc: The mechanism that powers the huntsman explodes when the construct is destroyed, projecting superheated steam and shrapnel. Each creature within 5 feet of the huntsman when it is destroyed must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The clockwork huntsman is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The clockwork huntsman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Alchemical Fireball
fields.desc: The clockwork myrmidon’s alchemical flame reservoir explodes when the construct is destroyed, spraying nearby creatures with burning fuel. Each creature within 10 feet of the myrmidon when it is destroyed must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This explosion doesn’t occur if the clockwork myrmidon has already fired its alchemical flame jet four times.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The clockwork myrmidon doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The clockwork myrmidon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The clockwork myrmidon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The clockwork watchman doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The clockwork watchman is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The clockwork watchman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The weaving spider doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The weaving spider is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The weaving spider has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Unmaking
fields.desc: The weaving spider’s speed and its slim, sharp blade can slice cloth, leather, and paper into scraps very quickly. Whenever a weaving spider’s Trimming Blade attack roll exceeds the target’s Armor Class by 5 or more, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or one nonmagical cloth, leather, or paper object on the target becomes damaged and unusable until repaired. This effect can deface or ruin clothing, backpacks, journals, and similar objects, but it can’t destroy armor.

fields.name: Clurichaun’s Luck
fields.desc: While the clurichaun is conscious and wearing no armor and wielding no shield, it adds its Charisma modifier to its AC (included above).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The clurichaun has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the cobbleswarm remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from normal stones.

fields.name: Shifting Floor
fields.desc: Whenever the cobbleswarm moves into a creature’s space or starts its turn in another creature’s space, the creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A prone creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check to stand up in a space occupied by the swarm.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The cobbleswarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny stone. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Underwater Camouflage
fields.desc: The coral drake has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The coral drake can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Absorb the Dead
fields.desc: Whenever a Large or smaller creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead dies within 10 feet of the corpse mound, that creature’s remains join with the mound, and the mound regains hp equal to twice the CR or level of the absorbed creature. The absorbed creature can’t be returned to life by any spell or effect that requires a body, unless the body is retrieved from the corpse mound.

fields.name: Noxious Aura
fields.desc: At the end of each of the corpse mound’s turns, each creature within 20 feet of it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the mound’s Noxious Aura for 24 hours.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The corpse mound doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Zombie Drop
fields.desc: At the start of each of the corpse mound’s turns, it can choose to have one corpse fall from it and immediately rise as a zombie under its control. The mound can have no more than ten zombies under its control at one time. Zombies take their turns immediately after the corpse mound’s turn.

fields.name: Magic-Infused Weapons
fields.desc: The power coursing through the corrupted chieftain’s veins flows into its weapons. The chieftain’s weapon attacks are magical. When the chieftain hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Spiked Hide
fields.desc: A creature that touches the ogre or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (2d4) piercing damage.

fields.name: Necrotic Weapons
fields.desc: The ushabti’s weapon attacks are magical. When the ushabti hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The ushabti regains 5 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

fields.name: Swarm Body
fields.desc: The corrupted ushabti is a spirit inhabiting a colony of scarabs around a Humanoid skeleton within funerary wrappings. It can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny scarab and Humanoid bones, and it can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp, except for its Regeneration trait.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The ushabti doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The ooze doesn’t require sleep.

fields.name: Putrid Stench
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the corrupting ooze must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) poison damage and be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The drake has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the crystalline devil’s darkvision.

fields.name: False Appearance (Gemstone Form Only)
fields.desc: While the devil remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary gemstone.

fields.name: Glittering Temptation (Gemstone Form Only)
fields.desc: The devil sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius. Each creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the devil and that can see it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 1 minute. While charmed, a creature is incapacitated and must move on its turn toward the devil by the safest route, trying to get within 5 feet of the devil to hold it. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a success, a creature is also immune to this devil’s Glittering Temptation for the next 24 hours. A creature charmed by the devil has disadvantage on the saving throw against Crystalline Spray.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The crystalline devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: The darakhul requires no air or sleep.

fields.name: Master of Disguise
fields.desc: A darakhul in a prepared disguise has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to pass as a living creature. While using this ability, it loses its Stench.

fields.name: Stench
fields.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the darakhul must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the darakhul’s Stench for the next 24 hours. A darakhul using this ability can’t also benefit from Master of Disguise.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the darakhul has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Turning Defiance
fields.desc: The darakhul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The dau has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Potent Poison
fields.desc: Undead with resistance or immunity to poison damage or the poisoned condition can be affected by the swarm’s poison.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Weight of Wings
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn in the swarm’s space has its speed halved and must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or become blinded. Both effects end when the creature ends its turn outside the swarm’s space. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the blinding effect of Weight of Wings for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
fields.desc: The deathcap takes 10 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

fields.name: Flicker
fields.desc: The deathwisp flickers in and out of sight. Ranged weapon attacks against it are made with disadvantage.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The deathwisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the deathwisp has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The deathwisp doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The drake has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the drake has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The deep one archimandrite can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Frenzied Rage
fields.desc: If a deep one archimandrite takes 15 or more damage from a single attack, it has advantage on all attack rolls and gains a +4 bonus to all damage rolls until the end of its next turn. For the duration, it can make one Unholy Trident attack as a bonus action on its turn.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The deep one priest can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Frenzied Rage
fields.desc: If a deep one priest takes 10 or more damage from a single attack, it has advantage on melee attack rolls and gains a +4 bonus to melee damage rolls until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Voice of the Deeps
fields.desc: The deep one priest can spend 5 minutes giving a speech in a rolling, droning voice that fascinates listeners. At the end of the speech, each creature that heard it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or forget the events of the past 10 minutes or keep no memory of the events of the next 5 minutes (the priest’s choice). On a successful saving throw, a creature is immune to the priest’s Voice of the Deeps for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The deep one can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Frenzied Rage
fields.desc: If a deep one takes 10 or more damage from a single attack, it has advantage on its Claws attack and gains a +2 bonus to damage with its Claws until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The degenerate titan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Desert Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of sand or gravel doesn’t cost the desert giant extra movement.

fields.name: Sand Camouflage
fields.desc: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

fields.name: Infernal Blessing
fields.desc: While the devilbound gnome is conscious and wearing no armor and wielding no shield, it adds its Charisma modifier to its AC (included above) and saving throws. In addition, magical darkness doesn’t impede the gnome’s darkvision.

fields.name: Infernal Bond
fields.desc: The devilbound gnome is magically bound to an imp. The imp acts as an ally of the gnome’s, obeying its spoken commands. The gnome can perceive through the imp’s senses, speak through its mouth, and communicate with it telepathically even if the two aren’t on the same plane of existence.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The devilbound gnome has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The dipsa can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Discreet Bite
fields.desc: The bite of a dipsa is barely perceptible and the wound is quickly anesthetized. When the dipsa hits with a Bite attack, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the dipsa and its attack. Each time the creature takes acid damage from an attached dipsa, it can repeat this check, noticing the dipsa on a success. A creature that takes acid damage from the dipsa while below half its hp maximum automatically succeeds on this check.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The dipsa doesn’t require sleep.

fields.name: Swamp Camouflage
fields.desc: The dipsa has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The dissimortuum can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The dissimortuum doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Burrowed Tunnels
fields.desc: If the juggernaut burrows at half its burrowing speed, it can leave a 10-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
fields.desc: If the juggernaut takes 15 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hp, it is reduced to 1 hp instead.

fields.name: Stout
fields.desc: The juggernaut has advantage on Strength and Dexterity checks and saving throws made against effects that would push it or knock it prone.

fields.name: Burrowed Tunnels
fields.desc: If the dogmole burrows at half its burrowing speed, it can leave a 5-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: House Guardian
fields.desc: When the domovoi finishes a long rest in a structure with up to 2,500 square feet of floor space, the structure becomes magically protected. This works like the guards and wards spell, except the domovoi can choose only two effects from the spell to place in the warded area.

fields.name: Arcane Doubling
fields.desc: While in combat, at the start of each of its turns, the doppelrat rapidly creates duplicates of itself as an automatic defense mechanism. These duplicates immediately form into a swarm of rats in the doppelrat’s space, acting as allies of the doppelrat and obeying its body language commands. The swarm acts on the doppelrat’s turn, and the doppelrat can use its reaction to move up to its speed with the swarm, provided it is in the swarm’s space when the swarm moves. The swarm remains for 1 minute, until the doppelrat dies, or until the doppelrat dismisses it as a bonus action. The doppelrat can have no more than two swarms of rats under its control at a time.

fields.name: Hidden Original
fields.desc: While the doppelrat is in the space of a swarm it created with Arcane Doubling, it is indiscernible from the other rats and has total cover. A creature must take an action to visually inspect the swarm and succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to find the doppelrat among its duplicates. Once a creature succeeds on this check, the doppelrat loses total cover against attacks and spells from that creature and that creature’s allies until the doppelrat starts its turn in the same space as one of its swarms.

fields.name: Horrific Doppeling
fields.desc: Characterized by the growing and sloughing off of tumors shaped like the infected creature, horrific doppeling is a disease that infects creatures attacked by doppelrats. Until the disease is cured, the creature is poisoned. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or shed a tumor that looks like a Tiny version of itself. Though disturbing, the tumor is merely a mass of shed skin and fat that decays as normal. The disease is cured after the creature succeeds on two saving throws.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The doppelrat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Void Warping
fields.desc: The area around the dorreq is warped by its connection to the Void. A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dorreq must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Limited Amphibiousness
fields.desc: The dragon eel can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 6 hours to avoid suffocating.

fields.name: Shocking Hide
fields.desc: A creature that touches the dragon eel or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage.

fields.name: Storm Glide
fields.desc: During storms with ample rain or lightning, the dragon eel gains a flying speed equal to its swimming speed.

fields.name: Elemental Affinity
fields.desc: The dragonleaf tree has immunity to a type of damage based on the type of dragon that grew it: acid ([black, copper), cold (silver, white), fire (brass, gold, red), lightning (blue, bronze), or poison (green).

fields.name: Eternally Loyal
fields.desc: The dragonleaf tree has advantage on ability checks and saving throws against influence or effects that would encourage it or force it to act against its draconic master. If charmed or controlled and directed to act against its master, the tree can immediately repeat the effect’s saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The drakon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Dissolving Gaze
fields.desc: When a creature that can see the drakon’s eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the drakon, the drakon can force it to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw if the drakon isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. On a failed save, the creature takes 3 (1d6) acid damage, its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the acid damage it takes, and it is paralyzed until the start of its next turn. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

fields.name: Dream Eater’s Caress
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn grappled by the dream eater must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw or take 5 (2d4) psychic damage. The dream eater gains temporary hp equal to the psychic damage dealt.

fields.name: Duelist’s Mobility
fields.desc: Opportunity attacks made against the duelist have disadvantage. If the duelist is prone at the start of its turn, it can immediately stand without costing movement.

fields.name: Fey Ancestry
fields.desc: The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Baleful Glare
fields.desc: When a creature that can see the eyes of the dullahan’s severed head starts its turn within 30 feet of the dullahan, the dullahan can force it to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw if the dullahan isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. While frightened in this way, the creature must take the Dash action and move away from the dullahan by the safest available route. A doomed creature that fails this saving throw is restrained while frightened instead.

fields.name: Relentless Advance
fields.desc: Moving through difficult terrain doesn’t cost the dullahan extra movement, and the dullahan can move across the surface of water as if it were harmless, solid ground.

fields.name: Relentless Nature
fields.desc: The dullahan doesn’t require food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Adhesive (Object or Terrain Form Only)
fields.desc: The dune mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the dune mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 15). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The dune mimic can harden its outer surface, so only the creatures it chooses are affected by this trait.

fields.name: False Appearance (Object or Terrain Form Only)
fields.desc: While the dune mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary sandy object or terrain feature.

fields.name: Grappler
fields.desc: The dune mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
fields.desc: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Tree Stride
fields.desc: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one dead tree within her reach and emerge from a second dead tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

fields.name: Twisted
fields.desc: When the dust goblin attacks a creature from hiding, the target must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Dwarven Resilience
fields.desc: The dwarven ringmage has advantage on saving throws against poison.

fields.name: Magic Maw
fields.desc: The eater of dust’s Maw-Arm attacks are magical. When the eater hits with its Maw-Arm, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The eater of dust regains 5 hp at the start of its turn. If it takes fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of eater’s next turn. The eater dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The edimmu can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Rejuvenation
fields.desc: If destroyed, an edimmu rises again in 2d4 days, regaining all its hp and becoming active again. When the edimmu rises, it appears within 5 feet of its remains. Only burying its mortal remains in consecrated or hallowed ground prevents this trait from functioning.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The edimmu doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Water Siphon
fields.desc: The edimmu has advantage on attack rolls against creatures made of or gaining power from magical water, such as water elementals, water jinnborn, water genies, and sorcerers with water-based origins. In addition, such creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw against the edimmu’s Draining Touch and Multiattack.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The eel hound can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The eel hound has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the hound’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Battle Frenzy
fields.desc: The einherjar has advantage on all attack rolls it makes while it is below 30 hp.

fields.name: Fearsome Gaze
fields.desc: The stare of an einherjar is especially piercing to Humanoids. It has advantage on any Charisma (Intimidation) check it makes against a Humanoid.

fields.name: Runic Weapons
fields.desc: The einherjar’s weapon attacks are magical. When the einherjar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Shadow Sight
fields.desc: The drake has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made while in dim light or darkness, and magical darkness doesn’t impede the drake’s darkvision.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The elemental locus doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immortal
fields.desc: If the elemental locus dies, it returns to life in 1d12 months, regaining all its hp and becoming active again. The new body appears in a space of the locus’s choice within its bound land. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

fields.name: Land Bound
fields.desc: The elemental locus is bound to an area of land or ocean no larger than 100 square miles. If it leaves this region, it loses its Spawn Elemental action. If it remains outside the region, it automatically teleports back to the center of this area after 24 hours, regardless of distance.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The elemental locus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The elemental locus deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Unstoppable
fields.desc: Moving through difficult terrain doesn’t cost the elemental locus extra movement, and its speed can’t be reduced.

fields.name: Beast Hunter
fields.desc: The elvish veteran archer has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track Beasts and on Intelligence (Nature) checks to recall information about Beasts.

fields.name: Fey Ancestry
fields.desc: The elvish veteran archer has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put the archer to sleep.

fields.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
fields.desc: The elvish veteran archer has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

fields.name: Point Blank Hunter
fields.desc: A longbow deals one extra die of its damage when the archer hits with it (included in the attack). In addition, when the archer makes a ranged attack with a longbow, it doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, though it may still have disadvantage from other sources.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The emerald eye doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The emerald eye is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Psychically Bound
fields.desc: The emerald eye must be psychically bound to a creature to survive. It loses 5 (2d4) hp for every hour it is not bound to a creature or every hour it is more than 30 feet away from its bound creature.

fields.name: Blessed Weapons
fields.desc: The cult leader’s weapons are blessed by its deity, and its weapon attacks are magical. When the cult leader hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Divine Blessing
fields.desc: While the cult leader is conscious and wearing no armor and wielding no shield, it adds its Wisdom modifier to its Armor Class (included above). In addition, it has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

fields.name: Prophetic Tactics
fields.desc: The cult leader has advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, at the start of each of the cult leader’s turns, one friendly creature within 30 feet of the cult leader has advantage on the first attack roll it makes before the start of the cult leader’s next turn.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The empty cloak doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Diligent Sentinel
fields.desc: The empty cloak has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

fields.name: Shadow Construction
fields.desc: Made mostly of shadow, the empty cloak bursts into pieces then dissipates when a creature scores a critical hit against it.

fields.name: Wrapping Embrace
fields.desc: The empty cloak can occupy a Medium or smaller creature’s space and vice versa. It has advantage on attack rolls against any creature in the same space as it.

fields.name: Fey Ancestry
fields.desc: The enchantress has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put her to sleep.

fields.name: Phrenic Weapons
fields.desc: The enchantress’s weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d6 psychic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Hardy
fields.desc: The erina has advantage on saving throws against poison.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The erina has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Spines
fields.desc: As the erina, except the spines now deal 5 (2d4) piercing damage.

fields.name: Hardy
fields.desc: The erina has advantage on saving throws against poison.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The erina has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Spines
fields.desc: A creature that touches the erina or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 (1d4) piercing damage. In addition, a creature grappled by or grappling the erina takes 2 (1d4) piercing damage at the start of the erina’s turn.

fields.name: Blinding Demise
fields.desc: When the golem reduces a creature to 0 hp, it can blind the creature permanently. If it does so, the creature is reduced to 1 hp instead.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The golem doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Light-Infused Fists
fields.desc: The golem’s Slam attacks are magical. When the golem hits with a Slam attack, the attack deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Visionary Flesh
fields.desc: A creature that eats the flesh of a fate eater must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is poisoned for 1 hour. On a success, the creature gains the benefits of the divination spell.

fields.name: Distortion Gaze
fields.desc: Those who meet the gaze of the fear smith experience the world seeming to twist at unnatural angles beneath their feet. When a creature that can see the fear smith’s eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the fear smith, the fear smith can force the creature to make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw if the fear smith isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. On a failed save, the creature is disoriented until the start of its next turn. While disoriented, a creature can’t take the Dash or Disengage action, and when it moves for the first time on its turn, it must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

fields.name: Hidden Eye
fields.desc: The fear smith has advantage on saving throws against being blinded.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The fear smith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The fellforged doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Inhabiting Spirit
fields.desc: The fellforged is inhabited and animated by a specter. If the fellforged fails a saving throw against an effect that turns undead, the specter is expelled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the fellforged with the hp total it had before it was expelled. The specter otherwise uses the statistics of a specter.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the fellforged has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Enchanted Cage
fields.desc: The savant is immune to damage and can’t be the target of spells or effects as long as its cage exists. The cage has a flying speed of 30 feet while the savant is inside of it, moving at the mental command of the savant. When the cage is destroyed, the savant floats gently to the ground. The cage has AC 19, 75 hp, and is immune to piercing, poison, and psychic damage. A non-derro that touches the cage or hits it with a melee weapon attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage and be frightened until the end of its next turn. The cage disintegrates if exposed to sunlight for 1 hour.

fields.name: Maddening Babble
fields.desc: The savant constantly babbles eldritch nonsense while it can see any non-derro creatures and isn’t incapacitated. Each non-derro creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the savant and can hear the babbling must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be incapacitated until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
fields.desc: The savant takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn outside the cage and in sunlight.

fields.name: Eldritch Weapons
fields.desc: The fext’s weapon attacks are magical. When the fext hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The fext has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Patron’s Blessing
fields.desc: While the fext is conscious and wearing no armor and wielding no shield, it adds its Charisma modifier to its AC (included above).

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The fext doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Aversion to Cold
fields.desc: If the feyward tree takes cold damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The feyward tree doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Enchanted Leaves
