fields.desc: The feyward tree’s Razor-Leafed Branch attacks are magical. When the tree hits with its Razor-Leafed Branch, the branch deals an extra 9 (2d8) force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The feyward tree is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Lightning Absorption
fields.desc: Whenever the feyward tree is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hp equal to the lightning damage dealt.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The feyward tree has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Warden’s Reach
fields.desc: A creature within 15 feet of a feyward tree that moves away from it provokes an opportunity attack even if the creature takes the Disengage action.

fields.name: Ever Connected
fields.desc: Fidele angels are magically connected. Damage taken by the fidele angel is split evenly between the fidele angel and its paired fidele angel. The angel that was the original target of the attack takes any damage that won’t divide evenly. All other effects, such as reducing ability scores or being the target of a bless spell, affect only the target.

fields.name: Immortal Nature
fields.desc: The fidele angel doesn’t require food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The angel’s weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Unshakeable Fidelity
fields.desc: No spell, feature, trait, magic, or other effect can cause a fidele angel to act against or harm its mate or change its love or loyalty toward its mate.

fields.name: Enforce Good Deeds
fields.desc: A creature that has received assistance, such as healing or a glowing feather, from the firebird must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the geas spell for 30 days. While under the geas, the affected creature must assist nonhostile creatures suffering from starvation or thirst by alleviating the starvation or thirst.

fields.name: Fiery Weapons
fields.desc: The firebird’s weapon attacks are magical. When the firebird hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Glowing Feathers
fields.desc: The firebird sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The firebird can alter the radius as a bonus action. If the firebird willingly gifts a feather to a creature, the feather sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet indefinitely.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The firebird has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Warming Presence
fields.desc: The firebird and each creature within 5 feet of it are immune to the effects of cold environments, provided the cold is caused by naturally occurring weather and climate. When the firebird is inside a structure, it can choose for this trait to affect all creatures within the structure (no action required), regardless of how close they are to it.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The firegeist doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Hide By Firelight
fields.desc: The firegeist has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in fire or in areas lit by nonmagical fire.

fields.name: Magical Light Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in an area of light created by a spell or other magical effect, the firegeist has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

fields.name: Variable Illumination
fields.desc: The firegeist sheds dim light in a 5- to 20-foot radius. It can alter the radius as a bonus action.

fields.name: Water Susceptibility
fields.desc: For every 5 feet the firegeist moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

fields.name: Massive Bulk
fields.desc: A flab giant can’t take the Dash action. In addition, a creature attempting to grapple, push, or knock the giant prone has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks to do so.

fields.name: Heated Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the flame dragon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Merciful Exchange
fields.desc: If the flutterflesh reduces a creature to 0 hp with a melee attack, it can cut off one of the creature’s limbs. If it does so, the target is reduced to 1 hp instead.

fields.name: Necrotic Weapons
fields.desc: The flutterflesh’s weapon attacks are magical. When the flutterflesh hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The flutterflesh regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the flutterflesh takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the flutterflesh’s next turn. The flutterflesh dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Turn Resistance
fields.desc: The flutterflesh has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The flutterflesh doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Ethereal Sight
fields.desc: The folk of Leng can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

fields.name: Leng Rejuvenation
fields.desc: If the folk of Leng dies on the Material Plane, it gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hp and becoming active again, unless it is killed with radiant damage wielded by a good-aligned creature or its remains are sprinkled with holy water within 24 hours of its death. The folk’s new body appears in its family’s crypt in Leng.

fields.name: Mortal Void Traveler
fields.desc: The folk of Leng doesn’t require air or ambient pressure.

fields.name: Phrenic Weapons
fields.desc: The folk of Leng’s weapon attacks are magical. When the folk hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d6 psychic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The folk of Leng regains 2 hp at the start of its turn. If the folk of Leng takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the folk’s next turn. The folk of Leng dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Charging Archer
fields.desc: If the forest hunter moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target after hitting the target with a Longbow attack, the forest hunter can make one Dagger attack against the target as a bonus action.

fields.name: Evasion
fields.desc: If the forest hunter is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half the damage, the hunter instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half the damage if it fails.

fields.name: Fey Ancestry
fields.desc: The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

fields.name: Forest and Urban Hunter
fields.desc: The forest hunter has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Survival) checks to find and track Beasts and Humanoids.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Forest Camouflage
fields.desc: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in forested terrain.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the forest marauder has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Deft Snow Walk
fields.desc: The fraughashar can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check, and difficult terrain composed of ice and snow doesn’t cost it extra movement. In addition, the fraughashar has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone while in icy or snowy terrain.

fields.name: Chilling Acidic Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the frostveil or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage.

fields.name: Damage Transfer
fields.desc: While engulfing a creature, the frostveil takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and the engulfed creature takes the other half.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the frostveil remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a formation of frost and ice.

fields.name: Windborne
fields.desc: In windy conditions, the frostveil’s flying speed increases to 30 feet. In a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour), its flying speed increases to 60 feet.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The garroter crab can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Strangling Divination
fields.desc: A Humanoid reduced to 0 hp while grappled by the garroter crab experiences a brief vision of the future. This effect works like the divination spell, except the reply is only as a mental vision and it can be about any specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 30 days. Once a creature has received a vision in this way, it can’t do so again for 30 days.

fields.name: Shifting Camouflage
fields.desc: The gbahali’s hide adapts to its current surroundings. The gbahali has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in nonmagical, natural terrain.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The gearforged templar doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Bred to the Saddle
fields.desc: The gerridae can’t be charmed or frightened while it has a rider.

fields.name: Water Bound
fields.desc: For every hour the gerridae spends on dry land, its hp maximum is reduced by 2 (1d4).

fields.name: Water Walker
fields.desc: The gerridae can move across the surface of water as if it were harmless, solid ground. This trait works like the water walk spell.

fields.name: Locked Saddle
fields.desc: The ghost knight can’t be knocked prone, dismounted, or moved against its will while mounted.

fields.name: Mounted Warrior
fields.desc: The ghost knight is rarely seen without its warhorse skeleton mount. The warhorse skeleton wears custom barding that raises its Armor Class to 15, and it has immunity to necrotic damage. While the ghost knight is mounted, its mount can’t be charmed or frightened.

fields.name: Necrotic Weapons
fields.desc: The ghost knight’s weapon attacks are magical. When the knight hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Spirited Charge
fields.desc: If the ghost knight moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature while mounted and then hits with a Lance attack on the same turn, the ghost knight can use a bonus action to command its mount to make one melee weapon attack against that creature as a reaction.

fields.name: Turning Defiance
fields.desc: The ghost knight and any undead within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The ghost knight doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Ghostly Body (Ghostwalk Form Only)
fields.desc: The ghostwalk spider has resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, and it has immunity to the grappled, paralyzed, petrified, and restrained conditions.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement (Ghostwalk Form Only)
fields.desc: The ghostwalk spider can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The giant ant queen has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Queen’s Scent
fields.desc: Giant ants within 30 feet of the queen have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that attacked the queen within the last minute.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The giant ant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the gilded devil’s darkvision.

fields.name: Golden Flail
fields.desc: The gilded devil’s Golden Flail attacks are magical. When the devil hits with the Golden Flail, the flail deals an extra 4d6 fire damage (included in the attack). In addition, the devil can transform the flail into gold jewelry or back into a weapon as a bonus action.

fields.name: Liar’s Largesse
fields.desc: If a creature accepts a gift of jewelry from the gilded devil, the creature becomes cursed until cured by a remove curse spell or similar magic. While cursed, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against the devil’s spells and abilities.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The gilded devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The glass gator can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Constricting Lunge
fields.desc: If the glass gator jumps at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the gator can make one Constrict attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The glass gator’s long jump is up to 15 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Transparent
fields.desc: The glass gator has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide while underwater or in dim light.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The gnarljak doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the gnarljak remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal bear trap.

fields.name: Harrying Attacks
fields.desc: If the gnoll attacks more than one creature in the same turn, the first target has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The gnoll has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the gnoll’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the goat-man moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

fields.name: Thirst Aura
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the gray thirster must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the gray thirster’s Thirst Aura for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: Thirsting Dead Nature
fields.desc: The gray thirster doesn’t require air, food, or sleep.

fields.name: Potent Poison
fields.desc: Undead with resistance or immunity to poison damage or the poisoned condition can be affected by the swarm’s poison.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Weight of Wings
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn in the swarm’s space has its speed halved and must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or become blinded. Both effects end when the creature ends its turn outside the swarm’s space. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the blinding effect of Weight of Wings for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: Glide
fields.desc: The lemurfolk has membranes between its fore and hind limbs that expand when falling to slow its rate of descent to 60 feet per round, landing on its feet and taking no falling damage. It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it falls. The lemurfolk can’t gain height with its gliding membranes alone. If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.

fields.name: Last Laugh
fields.desc: Unless it is destroyed in a manner amusing to the god of death that created it, the grim jester gains a new body in 1d20 days, regaining all its hp and becoming active again. The new body appears in a place of the god’s choosing.

fields.name: Mock the Dying
fields.desc: Death saving throws made within 60 feet of the grim jester have disadvantage.

fields.name: Turn Resistance
fields.desc: The grim jester has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The grim jester doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Fey Ancestry
fields.desc: The shadow fey guardian has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

fields.name: Shadow’s Vigil
fields.desc: The guardian has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks, and magical darkness doesn’t impede the guardian’s darkvision.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Towering Strength
fields.desc: The gug is considered to be a Gargantuan giant for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

fields.name: Death Sense
fields.desc: The sphinx can pinpoint, by scent, the location of each creature below half its hp maximum within 60 feet of it, and it can sense the general direction of creatures that don’t have all of their hp within 1 mile of it. In addition, the sphinx can foretell the age and manner of a creature’s death by looking at it. This effect doesn’t take into account possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the casting of powerful spells or the creature making a radical change in its life’s path.

fields.name: Inscrutable
fields.desc: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The sphinx’s weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The haugbui can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the haugbui has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Turn Resistance
fields.desc: The haugbui has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The hangbui doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Blood Armor
fields.desc: Each time a creature with blood hits the herald with a melee attack while within 10 feet of the herald, the creature takes 4 (1d8) necrotic damage, and the herald’s AC increases by 1 until the end of its next turn. The herald’s AC can’t be increased to more than 20 from this trait.

fields.name: Made of Shadows (Shadow Form Only)
fields.desc: The herald of darkness has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage and can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. In addition, it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Shadow’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the herald’s darkvision.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The golem doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Enchanted Weapons
fields.desc: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical. When the golem hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Strike with Awe
fields.desc: A creature that enters a space within 120 feet of the hoard golem or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while it remains within 120 feet of the golem.

fields.name: Implant Egg
fields.desc: If the horakh reduces a creature to 0 hp with a Bite attack or as a bonus action while within 5 feet of a creature with 0 hp, the horakh can implant an egg in the creature. The implanted egg rests in the creature’s eye socket for 14 days while it incubates. A host creature can carry only one horakh egg to term at a time. While the egg is implanted, the host can’t use its eye and has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. Exactly 24 hours before the egg hatches, the host becomes blinded. When the egg hatches, the young horakh erupts from the host’s head, killing the host in the process.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The horakh’s long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Fey Scent
fields.desc: The hound of the night has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. If it is tracking a Fey, Giant, or Humanoid whose scent it knows, the hound can continue tracking that creature if the creature moves into the Border Ethereal or teleports, provided the creature isn’t in the Border Ethereal for more than 1 minute or that the creature doesn’t teleport more than 100 feet at a time.

fields.name: Influence Weather
fields.desc: Nearby weather responds to Hraesvelgr’s desires. At the start of each minute, Hraesvelgr can choose to change the precipitation and wind within 3 miles of him by one stage, up or down (no action required). This effect works like the changing weather conditions aspect of the control weather spell, except Hraesvelgr can’t change the temperature and the conditions change immediately.

fields.name: Keen Sight (Roc Form Only)
fields.desc: Hraesvelgr has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If Hraesvelgr fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Frightened Anger (Hulking Form Only)
fields.desc: The hulking whelp has disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects that reduce strong emotions, such as the calm emotions spell.

fields.name: Pacify (Hulking Form Only)
fields.desc: A friendly creature that has interacted peacefully with the hulking whelp in its whelp form can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The hulking whelp must be able to hear the creature, who must take an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the hulking whelp transforms back into its whelp form on its next turn and stops attacking. If the hulking whelp takes damage before then, it remains in its hulking form and continues attacking.

fields.name: Unleashed Emotion (Hulking Form Only)
fields.desc: On each of the hulking whelp’s turns, it attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the hulking whelp attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack for two turns in a row, the hulking whelp uses Change Shape to return to its whelp form and stops attacking.

fields.name: Inscrutable
fields.desc: The hundun is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the hundun’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The hundun has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Radiant Fists
fields.desc: The hundun’s Slam attacks are magical. When the hundun hits with a Slam attack, the attack deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Collective Mind
fields.desc: Ia’Affrat’s individual Fiends are connected via a hive mind. He can telepathically communicate with any of his individual Fiends within 50 miles of him, and he can’t be surprised. If he is reduced to half his hp or lower, his Intelligence score is reduced to 10, he immediately changes into his shapeless form, and he can’t take on a Humanoid form again until he regains hp to be above half his hp or he finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede Ia’Affrat’s darkvision.

fields.name: Grasping Limbs (Humanoid Form Only)
fields.desc: Ia’Affrat can wield weapons and hold, grasp, push, pull, or interact with objects that might otherwise require a more Humanoid form to accomplish.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If Ia’Affrat fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: Ia’Affrat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Smoke Shroud
fields.desc: Ia’Affrat emits a cloud of dark smoke within 5 feet of himself. The area is lightly obscured to all except Ia’Affrat, and each non-devil creature that starts its turn in the smoke must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of its turn. At the start of each of his turns, Ia’Affrat chooses whether this shroud is active.

fields.name: Swarm (Shapeless Form Only)
fields.desc: Ia’Affrat can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa and can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect, but he can’t grapple or be grappled.

fields.name: Chilling Presence
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the ice maiden must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) cold damage. Unprotected, nonmagical flames within 15 feet of the maiden are extinguished, and water freezes if it remains within 15 feet of the maiden for at least 1 minute.

fields.name: Ice Walk
fields.desc: The ice maiden can move across icy and snowy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost her extra movement.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The ice maiden has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Snow Sight
fields.desc: The ice maiden can see through areas obscured by snow or fog without penalty.

fields.name: Apostasy Aura
fields.desc: The idolic deity’s presence causes devout followers to doubt their faith. When a creature attempts to use divine or celestial power, such as a cleric casting a spell or a paladin using Divine Smite, it must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the spell, class feature, or other divine or celestial power is expended, but it has no effect.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The idolic deity doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the idolic deity remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The idolic deity can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: The ghoul requires no air or sleep.

fields.name: Turning Defiance
fields.desc: The ghoul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the ink devil’s darkvision.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The ink devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: The ghoul requires no air or sleep.

fields.name: Turning Defiance
fields.desc: The iron ghoul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

fields.name: Influence Weather
fields.desc: Nearby weather responds to the isonade’s desires. At the start of each minute, the isonade can choose to change the precipitation and wind within 1 mile of it by one stage, up or down (no action required). This effect works like the changing weather conditions aspect of the control weather spell, except the isonade can’t change the temperature and the conditions change immediately.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The isonade has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The isonade deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The isonade can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Spearhead
fields.desc: If the jaculus moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The jaculus’s long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Camouflaged Webs
fields.desc: With 10 minutes of work, the j’ba fofi can create a camouflaged web in a 10-foot cube. The web must be anchored between two solid mases or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling. A camouflaged web layered over a flat surface has a depth of 5 feet. The web is camouflaged to match its surroundings, requiring a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice them. Each creature that starts its turn in the camouflaged web or that enters it during the creature’s turn must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained. A creature, including the restrained creature, can take its action to break the webbing and free the restrained creature by succeeding on a DC 13 Strength check. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

fields.name: Forest Camouflage
fields.desc: The j’ba fofi has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in forested terrain.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The j’ba fofi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Spider Passivism
fields.desc: No spider can willingly attack the j’ba fofi, unless attacked first. A spider can be forced to do so through magical means.

fields.name: Web Sense
fields.desc: While in contact with a web, the j’ba fofi knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The j’ba fofi ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

fields.name: Demigod’s Vitality
fields.desc: The jotun’s ability scores and hp maximum can’t be reduced except by means of a wish spell.

fields.name: Icy Weapons
fields.desc: The jotun’s weapon attacks are magical. When the jotun hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 6d8 cold damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The jotun has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Material Bound
fields.desc: The jotun is immune to any spell or effect that would force it to leave the Material Plane, unless the jotun wants to leave. It has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would return it to the Material Plane from another plane of existence.

fields.name: Too Big to Notice
fields.desc: While the jotun remains motionless in nonmagical, natural terrain, it has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The kalke has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

fields.name: Sense Magic
fields.desc: The kalke senses magic within 120 feet of it at will and can sense the general direction of spells being cast within 1 mile of it. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn’t itself magical.

fields.name: Hidden Home
fields.desc: The kikimora can spend 1 minute scribing a magical symbol on a wall, baseboard, cupboard, or other semi-permanent object within a structure. The symbol remains until the kikimora inscribes another symbol elsewhere. While within 5 feet of the surface where the symbol is inscribed, the kikimora can use an action to touch the symbol and be transported to an extradimensional space just large enough to hold the kikimora and up to 50 pounds of nonmagical objects. Only the kikimora can enter this space, along with any nonmagical objects it is wearing or carrying, up to the extradimensional space’s limits. While inside the extradimensional space, the kikimora can see out as if through a 2-foot-by-2-foot window centered on the symbol and can exit the space as an action, appearing in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the surface where the symbol is inscribed.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The kikimora has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Fiendish Weapons
fields.desc: The kishi’s weapon attacks are magical. When the kishi hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 cold damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The kishi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Two Heads
fields.desc: The kishi has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

fields.name: Breaker of Boats
fields.desc: The kongamato deals double damage to objects and structures made of wood or lighter materials.

fields.name: Carry Off
fields.desc: The kongamato can fly at half its flying speed when dragging two creatures it has grappled or at its full flying speed if dragging only one creature it has grappled.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The kongamato doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness does not impair the koralk’s darkvision.

fields.name: Harvester Venom
fields.desc: The koralk produces a potent poison that liquefies the innards of those affected by it. Every hour that elapses after a creature succumbs to this poison, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) poison damage, and its hp maximum is reduced by that amount. Creatures with resistance or immunity to poison or the poisoned condition can be affected by this poison. Such creatures have advantage on the saving throw.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The koralk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Steadfast
fields.desc: The koralk can’t be frightened while it can see an ally within 30 feet of it.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The krake spawn can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The lake troll can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The lake troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The lake troll regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the lake troll takes cold or fire damage, it regains only 5 hp at the start of its next turn. If the lake troll takes both cold and fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the lake troll’s next turn. The lake troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Magical Darkness Hypersensitivity
fields.desc: While in an area of magical darkness, the lantern dragonette can’t fly or use Lantern Belly, and it takes 3 (1d6) necrotic damage each minute.

fields.name: Glide
fields.desc: The lemurfolk has membranes between its fore and hind limbs that expand when falling to slow its rate of descent to 60 feet per round, landing on its feet and taking no falling damage. It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it falls. The lemurfolk can’t gain height with its gliding membranes alone. If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The leshy can mimic animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Insight) check.

fields.name: Plant Camouflage
fields.desc: The leshy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

fields.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
fields.desc: The leshy can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Vine-Wrapped Weapons
fields.desc: The poisonous vines growing from the leshy entwine around its weapon. When the leshy hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d4 poison damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Woodland Stride
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of magical or nonmagical plants doesn’t cost the leshy extra movement.

fields.name: Bibliophile
fields.desc: The library automaton understands any written language it can see, provided it is touching the surface on which the words are written.

fields.name: Bibliotelekinesis
fields.desc: The library automaton is surrounded by an invisible, shapeless, magical force that can perform simple tasks at the automaton’s command. This force has a Strength equal to the automaton’s Strength, and it can interact with objects up to 15 feet away from the automaton. The automaton can use this force to perform simple tasks that a Small humanoid with two hands could do, such as opening a door, moving a bookshelf’s ladder, picking up and organizing books, and similar tasks. The automaton can’t use this force to make attacks or wield a weapon or shield.

fields.name: Book Safekeeper
fields.desc: The library automaton’s body contains a small, extradimensional space. This space can hold up to 100 pounds of Small or smaller objects. This space can hold only books, scrolls, parchment, or other written works on paper or other paper- or wood-like materials. The automaton is the only creature capable of retrieving items from this space while it is alive. If the automaton is destroyed, the objects within its extradimensional space are ejected into an unoccupied space nearest it.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The library automaton doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Blood Sense
fields.desc: The lich hound can pinpoint the location of creatures that aren’t Constructs or Undead within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The lich hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The lich hound doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Limited Telepathy
fields.desc: The likho can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn’t allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The likho has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the likho moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the likho can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Ice Walk
fields.desc: The lindwurm can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost it extra movement.

fields.name: Sure-Footed Skater
fields.desc: While the lindwurm is on snow or ice, it has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

fields.name: Darkness Hypersensitivity
fields.desc: The liosalfar takes 15 necrotic damage when it starts its turn in magical darkness. While in magical darkness, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The liosalfar doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Inscrutable
fields.desc: The liosalfar is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the liosalfar’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

fields.name: Light Form
fields.desc: The liosalfar can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, it sheds bright light in a 10- to 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The liosalfar can alter the radius as a bonus action.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The living wick doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Wick-Powered
fields.desc: The living wick is inactive and unconscious while its wick is unlit. When its wick is lit, it obeys the commands of the creature that lit the wick, and it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The living wick’s hp maximum is reduced by 2 (1d4) for every 24 hours it remains lit and active, and no effect short of a wish spell can remove this reduction. The living wick dies when its hp maximum is reduced to 0.

fields.name: Huntsman’s Weapons
fields.desc: The Lord of the Hunt’s weapon attacks are magical. When he hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 14 (4d6) poison damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the Lord of the Hunt fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Sure Seat
fields.desc: While mounted and not incapacitated, the Lord of the Hunt can’t be knocked prone, dismounted, or moved against his will.

fields.name: Alluring Presence
fields.desc: When a Humanoid that can see the lorelei starts its turn within 30 feet of the lorelei, the lorelei can force it to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw if the lorelei isn't incapacitated and can see the Humanoid. On a failed save, the Humanoid is charmed until the start if its next turn. While charmed, the target is incapacitated and must move on its turn toward the lorelei by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet of the lorelei for a kiss from her. The Humanoid doesn’t avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage, the Humanoid can repeat the saving throw. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends for it, and it regains its senses for the remainder of its turn.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The lorelei can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Free Water Spirit
fields.desc: While in contact with water, the lorelei ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can’t reduce her speed or cause her to be restrained. In addition, she can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the lunar devil’s darkvision.

fields.name: Light Incorporeality
fields.desc: The lunar devil is translucent when standing in moonlight and is immune to damage from all nonmagical weapons in such conditions.

fields.name: Lightwalking
fields.desc: Once on its turn, the lunar devil can use half its movement to step magically into one area of moonlight within its reach and emerge from a second area of moonlight within 80 feet of the first, appearing in an unoccupied space within that second area.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The lunar devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The mahoru can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Blood Frenzy
fields.desc: The mahoru has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn’t have all of its hp.

fields.name: Keen Sight and Smell
fields.desc: The mahoru has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The mahoru has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the mahoru’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Blistering Radiance
fields.desc: The malakbel sheds searing, bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. At the start of each of the malakbel’s turns, each creature in the bright light shed by the malakbel takes 11 (2d10) radiant damage. If any of the bright light overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell creating the darkness is dispelled.

fields.name: Distortion
fields.desc: Ranged attacks against the malakbel are made with disadvantage.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The malakbel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The mallqui regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the mallqui takes radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the mallqui’s next turn. The mallqui dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The mallqui doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Water Hypersusceptibility
fields.desc: For every 5 feet the mallqui moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 2 (1d4) radiant damage. In addition, the mallqui takes 10 radiant damage when it starts its turn at least partially submerged in water.

fields.name: Shadow-Infused Weapons
fields.desc: The malphas’s weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d6 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the malphas has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Distracting Babble
fields.desc: When a spellcaster that is concentrating on a spell starts its turn within 20 feet of the mamura, the spellcaster must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or lose concentration on the spell. In addition, if a spellcaster within 20 feet of the mamura casts a spell, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or the spell fails to cast, using the action, bonus action, or reaction to cast the spell but not expending the spell slot.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The mamura doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The mamura has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Radial Eyes
fields.desc: The mamura has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on saving throws against being blinded. In addition, if the mamura isn’t blinded, creatures attacking it can’t benefit from traits and features that rely on a creature’s allies distracting or surrounding the mamura, such as the Pack Tactics trait or Sneak Attack class feature.

fields.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
fields.desc: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

fields.name: Life Path
fields.desc: Regardless of the form it takes, the map mimic can make a map on its surface (no action required) that shows the route it has traveled since it left its parent mimic. The map shows terrain features and landmarks of where it has been, but doesn’t show the names of those places.

fields.name: Necrotic Weapons
fields.desc: The mask wight’s weapon attacks are magical. When the mask wight hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Single-Minded Purpose
fields.desc: The mask wight has advantage on attack rolls against fiends and creatures wielding fiendish power, such as tieflings or some sorcerers and warlocks.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The mask wight doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Mounted Warrior
fields.desc: While the mavka is mounted, her mount can’t be charmed or frightened.

fields.name: Nightmare Mount
fields.desc: The mavka has formed a bond with a nightmare. The nightmare acts as a controlled mount while carrying the mavka, obeying the mavka’s spoken commands. Mounting and dismounting the nightmare costs the mavka only 5 feet of movement.

fields.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
fields.desc: The mavka takes 20 radiant damage when she starts her turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, she has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The mavka doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The mbielu can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

fields.name: Toxic Skin
fields.desc: A creature that touches the mbielu or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 (1d4) poison damage and must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, a creature has disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws as it experiences mild hallucinations. The poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

fields.name: Demon Lord’s Ichor
fields.desc: When Mechuiti is subjected to piercing damage or slashing damage, a spray of caustic blood spurts from his hide. Each creature within 10 feet of Mechuiti must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or becoming infected with the Mechuiti’s deadly ichor disease and be poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hp maximum by 14 (4d6) on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hp maximum to 0. The disease can be cured by the greater restoration spell or similar magic or when the creature succeeds on three saving throws.

fields.name: Fiery Weapons
fields.desc: Mechuiti’s weapon attacks are magical. When Mechuiti hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 6d6 fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Immolating Corona
fields.desc: At the start of each of Mechuiti’s turns, each creature within 10 feet of him takes 10 (3d6) fire damage and must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or catch fire. A creature that touches Mechuiti or hits him with a melee attack while within 5 feet of him takes 10 (3d6) fire damage and must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or catch fire. Until a creature uses an action to douse the fire, the creature on fire takes 7 (2d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If Mechuiti fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: Mechuiti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Speak with Simians
fields.desc: Mechuiti can communicate with apes and monkeys as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Deathly Spores
fields.desc: When a mi-go dies, its body crumbles into millions of spores. Each creature within 10 feet of the mi-go must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (4d6) poison damage and be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Void Traveler
fields.desc: The mi-go doesn’t require air, food, drink, sleep, or ambient pressure. It requires only minimal exposure to starlight a few times each year to sustain itself.

fields.name: Fungal Aura
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a mindrot thrall must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become infected with the mindrot disease.

fields.name: Mindrot
fields.desc: A creature infected with this disease manifests symptoms in 1d4 days after infection, which include migraines and muscle weakness. Until the disease is cured, at the end of each long rest, the infected creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 9 (2d8) acid damage, and its hp maximum is reduced by that amount. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest after the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hp maximum to 0. One day after the creature dies, it rises as a mindrot thrall. A creature that succeeds on two saving throws recovers from the disease.

fields.name: Sensuous Grace
fields.desc: The mirager moves with a flowing grace that Humanoids find appealing. If the mirager moves at least 10 feet on its turn, each Humanoid within 30 feet of it that can see it must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw or be charmed until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The miremal can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Muddled Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
fields.desc: If the miremal takes 7 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hp, it is reduced to 1 hp instead and becomes a puddle of filthy swamp water. At the start of the miremal’s next turn, it can move up to 15 feet as a puddle. Then it returns to its normal form.

fields.name: Swamp Camouflage
fields.desc: The miremal has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

fields.name: Confounding Ugliness
fields.desc: Any Humanoid that starts its turn within 60 feet of the hag and can see the hag’s true form must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be incapacitated until the start of its next turn. If the Humanoid’s saving throw is successful, it is immune to the hag’s Confounding Ugliness for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Ethereal Coat
fields.desc: The mngwa’s AC includes its Charisma modifier (included above).

fields.name: Ethereal Sight
fields.desc: The mngwa can see 30 feet into the Ethereal Plane when on the Material Plane and vice versa.

fields.name: Feline Passivism
fields.desc: No felines or weretigers can willingly attack the mngwa. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The mngwa has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The mngwa has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the mngwa’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Running Leap
fields.desc: With a 10-foot running start, the mngwa can long jump up to 25 feet.

fields.name: Speak with Felines
fields.desc: The mngwa can communicate with felines as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Coldfire Weapons
fields.desc: The monolith champion’s weapon attacks are imbued with blue fey fire and magical. When the champion hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 cold damage or fire damage (included in the attack), the champion’s choice.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The monolith champion doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Coldfire Weapons
fields.desc: The monolith footman’s weapon attacks are imbued with blue fey fire and magical. When the footman hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 1d8 cold damage or fire damage (included in the attack), the champion’s choice.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The monolith footman doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Simple Construction
fields.desc: A critical hit against the footman causes it to burst into pieces and be destroyed. Each creature within 5 feet of the footman must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the Moonlit King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Moonlit Weapons
fields.desc: The Moonlit King’s weapon attacks are magical. When he hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 14 (4d6) radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The mordant snare has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Mordant Puppets
fields.desc: A mordant snare can spend 8 hours draining a dead Humanoid of its fluids and internal organs, replacing them with the snare’s acid and filaments. The Humanoid’s body then becomes a puppet controlled by the snare. Mordant puppets share a telepathic link with the snare, and each puppet uses the statistics of a zombie. The puppets can’t move more than 30 feet away from the snare. The mordant snare can have no more than twelve puppets under its control at one time.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The morphoi can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Forest Camouflage
fields.desc: A moss lurker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in forested terrain.

fields.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The moss lurker has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

fields.name: Poisoned Gifts
fields.desc: A moss lurker can spend 1 minute stirring one of its red claws in a drink or cooked meal, contaminating the food or drink. A creature that eats or drinks the contaminated food or drink must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

fields.name: Enfeebling Attacks
fields.desc: Each time the myling deals necrotic damage to a creature that is below half its hp maximum, the target’s Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The myling doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Sense Magic
fields.desc: The naina senses magic within 120 feet of her at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn’t itself magical.

fields.name: Multiple Heads
fields.desc: The necrohydra has five fleshy heads. While it has more than one head, the necrohydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious. Whenever the necrohydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its fleshy heads dies. If all its fleshy heads die, the necrohydra can’t use Unnerving Faces and can’t use or maintain Dreadful Dirge.

fields.name: Reactive Heads
fields.desc: For each head the necrohydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The necrohydra doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Elephants’ Bane
fields.desc: The ngobou has advantage on attack rolls against elephants. It can pinpoint, by scent, the location of any elephant or elephant material no older than 48 hours within 120 feet of it.

fields.name: Jagged Hide
fields.desc: At the start of each of its turns, the ngobou deals 4 (1d8) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

fields.name: Reckless
fields.desc: At the start of its turn, the ngobou can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn. If the ngobou detects an elephant within 120 feet of it, this trait is always active, and the ngobou can’t choose to end it until it starts its turn more than 120 feet from an elephant.

fields.name: Trampling Charge
fields.desc: If the ngobou moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the ngobou can make one Stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Aura of Luck
fields.desc: The nichny is surrounded by an aura that manipulates the luck of those near the nichny. Each friendly creature, other than the nichny, within 10 feet of the nichny has a +1 bonus to attack rolls and saving throws. Each hostile creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the nichny must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its turn.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The nichny has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Soothsaying (1/Day)
fields.desc: The nichny can spend 1 minute conversing with a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. During this time, the creature can ask up to three questions about the past, present, or future. At the end of the minute, the nichny then offers two truthful answers and one false answer, each in the form of a paradox, riddle, or cryptic rhyme.

fields.name: Telepathic Bond
fields.desc: The nightgarm ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a falseheart it has birthed. The nightgarm and its falseheart don’t need to be on the same plane of existence.

fields.name: Ghostly Body (Void Ghost Form Only)
fields.desc: The nihileth has resistance to acid, fire, lightning, and thunder damage, it has immunity to the prone condition, and it has immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, the nihileth can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Infecting Telepathy
fields.desc: If a creature communicates telepathically with the nihileth, or deals psychic damage to it, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become infected with the nihilethic rot disease.

fields.name: Nihilethic Rot
fields.desc: This disease takes 1 minute to manifest in an infected creature, during which time the disease can be removed with the lesser restoration spell. After 1 minute, the creature’s flesh becomes slimy and translucent, and the disease can be cured only by the heal spell or similar magic. Until this disease is cured, the creature can’t regain hp unless it is submerged in water, and it can breathe air and water. The creature must be submerged in water at least once every 2 hours to avoid suffocating, and if it is outside a body of water, it takes 7 (2d6) acid damage every 10 minutes, unless moisture is applied to its skin before 10 minutes have passed. If a Humanoid dies while infected with this disease, it rises 1 minute later as a nihilethic zombie under the nihileth’s control. If a Large giant or monstrosity dies while infected with this disease, it rises 1 minute later as a nihilethic dominator under the nihileth’s control.

fields.name: Undead Fortitude
fields.desc: If damage reduces the nihileth to 0 hp, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the nihileth drops to 1 hp instead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The nihileth doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Void Aura
fields.desc: The nihileth is surrounded by a chilling cloud. A creature that isn’t a construct or undead and that starts its turn within 5 feet of the nihileth must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its speed is halved until the start of its next turn. In addition, a creature infected with nihilethic rot takes 7 (2d6) cold damage when it starts its turn within this aura.

fields.name: Ghostly Body (Void Ghost Form Only)
fields.desc: The nihilethic dominator has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, the dominator can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Undead Fortitude
fields.desc: If damage reduces the nihilethic dominator to 0 hp, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the dominator drops to 1 hp instead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The nihilethic dominator doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Ghostly Body (Void Ghost Form Only)
fields.desc: The nihilethic zombie has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, the zombie can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Undead Fortitude
fields.desc: If damage reduces the nihilethic zombie to 0 hp, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hp instead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The nihilethic zombie doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Brute
fields.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the pridelord hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The nkosi has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the nkosi moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Mambele attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the nkosi can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The nkosi has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the nkosi moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Mambele attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the nkosi can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Eldritch Weapons
fields.desc: The noctiny’s weapon attacks are magical. When the noctiny hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The noctiny has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Hundreds of Eyes
fields.desc: The oculo swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on saving throws against being blinded. In addition, if the swarm isn’t blinded, creatures attacking it can’t benefit from traits and features that rely on a creature’s allies distracting or surrounding the swarm, such as the Pack Tactics trait or Sneak Attack class feature.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny eyeball. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The oozasis can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Oasis Appearance
fields.desc: While the oozasis remains motionless and partially submerged on the surface of sand or soil, it is indistinguishable from a small oasis or pond. The oozasis’s body provides enough water for plants to grow around it, provided the oozasis remains in the area for an extended period of time. A creature that eats a fruit from a plant growing in the oozasis’s water is affected by the Waters of Unfathomable Compulsion trait as if it drank the water.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The oozasis doesn’t require sleep.

fields.name: Waters of Unfathomable Compulsion
fields.desc: A creature that drinks the water of an oozasis experiences a cryptic dream the next time it sleeps. When it wakes, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the geas spell for 30 days. While under the geas, the affected creature must perform a specific, seemingly minor task that furthers the decades-long goals of the oozasis. Such a task could be planting a white rose in a specific garden, rescuing the next endangered young animal the target encounters, or standing in a specific spot at a certain time each day for three days.

fields.name: Deceptive Advice
fields.desc: When the orobas casts a spell of the divination school, it has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks for 1 minute.

fields.name: Hellish Weapons
fields.desc: The orobas’s weapon attacks are magical. When the orobas hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The orobas has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Sense Consecrated
fields.desc: The orobas can pinpoint the location of Celestials, consecrated places or objects, and creatures wielding divine or celestial power, such as clerics, paladins, or aasimars, within 60 feet of it.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The ostinato can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Invisibility
fields.desc: The ostinato is invisible.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The ostinato has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Hypersensitive Hearing
fields.desc: The owl harpy has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing, and it can’t use its blindsight while deafened.

fields.name: Quiet Wings
fields.desc: The owl harpy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide while flying.

fields.name: Blood Sense
fields.desc: The pact vampire can pinpoint the location of creatures that aren’t Constructs or Undead within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the pact vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Poisonous Blood
fields.desc: A creature that hits the pact vampire with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) poison damage.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The pact vampire regains 25 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp and isn’t in sunlight. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the vampire’s next turn.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The pact vampire doesn’t require air.

fields.name: Vampire Weaknesses
fields.desc: The pact vampire has the following flaws:

fields.name: Bibliophile
fields.desc: The paper drake understands any written language it can see, provided it is touching the surface on which the words are written.

fields.name: False Appearance (Book Form Only)
fields.desc: While the drake remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary book.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The planewatcher has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Planar Sense
fields.desc: The planewatcher can pinpoint the location of creatures not native to the plane the planewatcher currently occupies and planar portals within 60 feet of it, and the planewatcher can sense the general direction of such creatures and portals within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Plane Bound
fields.desc: The planewatcher is immune to any spell or effect that would force it to leave its current plane, unless it wants to leave.

fields.name: Word-Bound
fields.desc: The planewatcher always knows the direction and distance to any creature that dispels, breaks, or otherwise avoids the geas of the promise it made via Planar Ultimatum, provided the planewatcher and the creature are on the same plane of existence. While grappling such a creature, it can cast the banishment spell as a bonus action (spell save DC 17) on that creature.

fields.name: Contortionist
fields.desc: The pombero can contort its body into unnatural positions, allowing it to easily move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The pombero’s destination must still have suitable room to accommodate its volume.

fields.name: Forest Camouflage
fields.desc: The pombero has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in forested terrain.

fields.name: Speak with Beasts
fields.desc: The pombero can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The possessed pillar doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Divine Fists
fields.desc: The possessed pillar’s weapon attacks are magical. When the pillar hits with a Slam attack, the Slam deals an extra 2d8 necrotic damage or radiant damage (included in the attack), the pillar’s choice.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the pillar remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a statue or a carved column.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The pillar is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The pillar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magnetic Body
fields.desc: The eldritch magic powering the possessed pillar causes the pillar’s body to produce a minor magnetic field. When a creature hits the pillar with a weapon made of metal, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or the weapon sticks to the pillar. If the creature can’t or won’t let go of the weapon, it is also stuck to the pillar and restrained. A stuck weapon can’t be used. A creature can take its action to remove one metal object from the pillar by succeeding on a DC 15 Strength check. The pillar can release one creature or metal object stuck to it as a bonus action. If the pillar dies, all creatures and metal objects stuck to it are released.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The psoglav has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The psoglav’s weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the putrid haunt remains motionless and prone in swampy terrain, it is indistinguishable from a pile of muck and moss.

fields.name: Swamp Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of mud, shallow water, and water plants doesn’t cost the putrid haunt extra movement.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The putrid haunt doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If Qorgeth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: Qorgeth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: Qorgeth’s weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Tunneler
fields.desc: Qorgeth can burrow through solid rock and leaves a 15-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the Queen of Night and Magic fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The Queen of Night and Magic has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Regal Bearing
fields.desc: While the Queen of Night and Magic is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes her Charisma modifier.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the Queen of Witches fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The Queen of Witches has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Moonlit Weapons
fields.desc: The Queen of Witches’s weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 7 (2d6) radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Token of Favor
fields.desc: The Queen of Witches can spend 1 minute cutting and tying a lock of her hair into a small token of her favor. A creature that is wearing or carrying the favor gains the benefits of the Magic Resistance trait. The Queen can revoke this magic at any time (no action required). If she does so, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects for 24 hours.

fields.name: Bludgeoning Bounce (Orb Form Only)
fields.desc: Whenever the quicksilver siege orb is subjected to bludgeoning damage, it takes no damage and instead is pushed up to 15 feet away from the source of the bludgeoning damage. If the damage is from a critical hit, the orb is pushed up to 30 feet.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The quicksilver siege orb doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The quicksilver siege orb doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The quicksilver siege orb is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Observant (Orb Form Only)
fields.desc: The quicksilver siege orb has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Insight) checks. In addition, if the orb observes a creature for at least 1 minute, it has advantage on the first three attack rolls it makes against the creature.

fields.name: Slippery
fields.desc: The quicksilver siege orb has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple.

fields.name: Nauseating Stench
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the qwyllion must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature that fails this saving throw is also incapacitated while poisoned in this way. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the qwyllion’s Nauseating Stench for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The ramag has advantage on saving throws against spells or other magical effects.

fields.name: Portal Sense
fields.desc: The ramag can pinpoint the location of planar portals within 100 feet of it and can sense the general direction of planar portals within 1 mile of it. In addition, if the ramag spends 10 minutes studying a portal, it can determine the portal’s destination and any requirements to use or activate it.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The rat king has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Plague of Ill Omen
fields.desc: The rat king radiates a magical aura of misfortune. A creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the rat king must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of its next turn.
