fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The ratatosk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Nimbleness
fields.desc: The ratfolk rogue can move through the space of any Medium or larger hostile creature, and such a space isn’t difficult terrain for the ratfolk.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The ratfolk rogue has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the ratfolk’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Nimbleness
fields.desc: The ratfolk can move through the space of any Medium or larger hostile creature, and such a space isn’t difficult terrain for the ratfolk.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The ratfolk has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the ratfolk’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The ravenala has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Woodland Stride
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of magical or nonmagical plants doesn’t cost the ravenala extra movement. In addition, it can pass through magical or nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The doom croaker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The ravenfolk doom croaker can mimic animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Insight) check.

fields.name: Rune-Powered Weapons
fields.desc: The ravenfolk’s weapon attacks are magical. When the ravenfolk hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The ravenfolk scout can mimic animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 13 Wisdom (Insight) check.

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The ravenfolk warrior can mimic animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Insight) check.

fields.name: Rune-Powered Weapons
fields.desc: The ravenfolk’s weapon attacks are magical. When the ravenfolk hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 1d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Reactive Venom
fields.desc: If the spider deals poison damage to a creature that is poisoned, the target takes an extra 2 (1d4) poison damage.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down and on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The red hag can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Blood Sense
fields.desc: The red hag can pinpoint the location of creatures that aren’t Constructs or Undead within 60 feet of her and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of her.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The red hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Speak with Beasts
fields.desc: The red hag can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Red Cap
fields.desc: The redcap must soak its cap in the blood of a Humanoid that has been dead for no more than 1 hour at least once every 3 days. Every 24 hours past the third day that it goes without soaking its cap in blood in this way, it suffers one level of exhaustion. This exhaustion can be reduced only when the redcap finishes a long rest after soaking its cap in fresh Humanoid blood, which reduces its exhaustion level to 0. If the redcap dies as a result of this exhaustion, it crumbles to dust.

fields.name: Chaos Mutations
fields.desc: At the start of each of its turns, the rift swine’s body experiences a mutation. Choose an option or roll a d6 to determine the type of mutation. The mutation lasts until the start of the rift swine’s next turn.

fields.name: Dozens of Eyes
fields.desc: The rift swine has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on saving throws against being blinded. In addition, if the rift swine isn’t blinded, creatures attacking it can’t benefit from traits and features that rely on a creature’s allies distracting or surrounding the rift swine, such as the Pack Tactics trait or Sneak Attack class feature.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The rime worm grub can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Ravenous Larva
fields.desc: The rime worm grub can make an opportunity attack against any creature that leaves its reach, even if the creature takes the Disengage action. In addition, it has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn’t have all its hp.

fields.name: Snow Camouflage
fields.desc: The rime worm grub has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

fields.name: Snow Stride
fields.desc: The rime worm grub can burrow through nonmagical snow and ice in addition to sand, earth, and mud. In addition, difficult terrain composed of snow or ice doesn’t cost it extra movement.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The rime worm can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Icy Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the rime worm or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) cold damage.

fields.name: Snow Camouflage
fields.desc: The rime worm has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

fields.name: Snow Stride
fields.desc: The rime worm can burrow through nonmagical snow and ice in addition to sand, earth, and mud. In addition, difficult terrain composed of snow or ice doesn’t cost it extra movement.

fields.name: Blood Sense
fields.desc: The risen reaver can pinpoint the location of creatures that aren’t Constructs or Undead within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The risen reaver doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The River King can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the River King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Riparian Weapons
fields.desc: The River King’s weapon attacks are magical. When he hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 10 (3d6) poison damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Hardy
fields.desc: The roachling is immune to diseases and has advantage on Constitution saving throws.

fields.name: Unpleasant Scent
fields.desc: The roachling has disadvantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks when interacting with Beasts and on Charisma checks when interacting with Humanoids. If the roachling bathes meticulously, it loses this trait for 24 hours.

fields.name: Hardy
fields.desc: The roachling is immune to diseases and has advantage on Constitution saving throws.

fields.name: Unpleasant Scent
fields.desc: The roachling has disadvantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks when interacting with Beasts and on Charisma checks when interacting with Humanoids. If the roachling bathes meticulously, it loses this trait for 24 hours.

fields.name: Air Form
fields.desc: The rotting wind can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Invisibility
fields.desc: The rotting wind is invisible.

fields.name: Poisonous Aura
fields.desc: The rotting wind radiates an aura of poison and decay that slowly pollutes the area within 30 feet of it. Each hour the rotting wind stays in a place, nonmagical plants in the aura begin to wither, and water in the aura becomes poisoned. Nonmagical plants in the aura for 24 hours die. A creature that drinks water poisoned by the aura must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or contract the tomb rot disease (see the Tomb Rot trait). Creatures immune to the poisoned condition are immune to this disease.

fields.name: Tomb Rot
fields.desc: A creature infested with this disease manifests symptoms 1d4 days after infection, which include muscle weakness and rotten-smelling breath as its body rots from the inside out. Until the disease is cured, at the end of each long rest, the infected creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and suffer one level of exhaustion. This exhaustion lasts until the creature finishes a long rest after the disease is cured. A creature that succeeds on two saving throws recovers from the disease.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The rotting wind doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Counting Compulsion
fields.desc: If a creature uses an action to point out an ordered group of objects that the rubezahl can see, such as a pile of gravel, the demon is compelled to count the entire group. Until the end of its next turn, the rubezahl has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and it can’t take reactions. Once it has counted a given group of objects, it can’t be compelled to count those objects again.

fields.name: False Tongue
fields.desc: The rubezahl has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks. In addition, magical attempts to discern lies always report that the rubezahl’s words are true, and it can’t be magically forced to tell the truth.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The rubezahl has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Aura of Drunkenness
fields.desc: The rum gremlin radiates an aura of drunkenness to a radius of 20 feet. Each creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. A creature that has consumed alcohol within the past hour has disadvantage on the saving throw. While poisoned, a creature falls prone if it tries to move more than half its speed during a turn. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the rum gremlin’s Aura of Drunkenness for 24 hours.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The rum gremlin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Rust Drake Lockjaw
fields.desc: A creature infected with this disease manifests symptoms 1d4 days after infection, which include painful muscle spasms, particularly in the jaw. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 hour and have its Dexterity score reduced by 1d4. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. If the disease reduces the creature’s Dexterity to 0, the creature dies. A creature that succeeds on two saving throws recovers from the disease.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the salt devil’s darkvision.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The salt devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Salt-Encrusted Hide
fields.desc: A creature that touches the salt devil or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) slashing damage.

fields.name: Blinding Salt Spray
fields.desc: When the salt golem takes damage, thousands of tiny salt crystals erupt from the golem’s body, and each creature within 5 feet of the golem must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The golem doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Dehydrating Fists
fields.desc: The salt golem’s Slam attacks are magical. When the golem hits with a Slam attack, the attack deals an extra 4d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The sand hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The sand hag can mimic animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 16 Wisdom (Insight) check.

fields.name: Scorpion Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of sand or gravel doesn’t cost the hag extra movement. In addition, while in sandy terrain, she doesn’t leave tracks and has tremorsense out to a range of 30 feet.

fields.name: Sand Camouflage
fields.desc: The sand silhouette has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in desert terrain.

fields.name: Sand Form
fields.desc: The sand silhouette can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Sand Glide
fields.desc: The sand silhouette can burrow through nonmagical, loose sand without disturbing the material it is moving through.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The sand silhouette doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Water Hypersusceptibility
fields.desc: For every 5 feet the sand silhouette moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 2 (1d4) cold damage. In addition, the silhouette takes 10 cold damage when it starts its turn at least partially submerged in water.

fields.name: Sand Camouflage
fields.desc: The sand spider has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The sandman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Stuff of Dreams
fields.desc: Made partially from dreams and imagination, the sandman isn’t fully real. Any critical hit against the sandman is a normal hit.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The sap demon can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The sap demon doesn’t require sleep.

fields.name: Season’s Change
fields.desc: If the sap demon takes fire damage, its speed is increased by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. If it takes cold damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The sarcophagus slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The sarcophagus slime doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Agonizing Aura
fields.desc: The sathaq worm emits ultrasonic noise and minor vibrations that cause pain and subtly disrupt the functions of most creatures. A creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the sathaq worm must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn. Creatures with resistance or immunity to thunder damage automatically succeed on the saving throw.

fields.name: Earth Glide
fields.desc: The sathaq worm can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the worm doesn’t disturb the material it moves through.

fields.name: Earthen Camouflage
fields.desc: The sathaq worm has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy, muddy, or rocky terrain.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The sathaq worm deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Mighty Swing
fields.desc: If the savager doesn’t move during its turn, it has advantage on the next Claw attack it makes before the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Spines
fields.desc: A creature that touches the savager or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (2d4) piercing damage. In addition, a creature grappled by or grappling the savager takes 5 (2d4) piercing damage at the start of the savager’s turn.

fields.name: Beard Weakness
fields.desc: A creature grappling the scheznyki can take its action to cut off the scheznyki’s beard by succeeding on a DC 15 Strength check while holding an edged weapon. If its beard is cut off, the scheznyki can’t use Spellcasting until its beard regrows.

fields.name: Brute
fields.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the scheznyki hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The scheznyki has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Dark Devotion
fields.desc: The scorpion cultist has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

fields.name: Keen Senses
fields.desc: The scorpion cultist has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

fields.name: Scorpion’s Blessing
fields.desc: The scorpion cultist has advantage on saving throws against poison. In addition, when the scorpion cultist hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 poison damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Poisoned Weapons
fields.desc: The selang’s weapons are coated with a magical poison. When the selang hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d6 poison damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Coastal Camouflage
fields.desc: The serpopard has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy, muddy, or swampy terrain.

fields.name: Sinuous Strikeback
fields.desc: The serpopard gets two extra reactions that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

fields.name: Magic Horn
fields.desc: The shadhavar’s Gore attacks are magical.

fields.name: Shadesight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the shadhavar’s darkvision.

fields.name: Evasion
fields.desc: If the shadow antipaladin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the antipaladin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

fields.name: Insanity
fields.desc: The shadow antipaladin has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The shadow antipaladin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Necrotic Weapons
fields.desc: The shadow antipaladin’s weapon attacks are magical. When the antipaladin hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow antipaladin has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The shadow beast can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The shadow beast has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Shadow Weapons
fields.desc: The shadow beast’s weapon attacks are magical. When the shadow beast hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow beast has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Fey Ancestry
fields.desc: The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The sharkjaw skeleton doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The shellycoat can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Hazesight
fields.desc: The shellycoat can see through areas obscured by fog, smoke, and steam without penalty.

fields.name: Keen Hearing
fields.desc: The shellycoat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The shellycoat regains 3 hp at the start of its turn. If the shellycoat takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the shellycoat’s next turn. The shellycoat dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Sunlight Petrification
fields.desc: If the shellycoat remains in nonmagical sunlight for 1 minute, it becomes petrified at the end of that minute.

fields.name: Water Camouflage
fields.desc: The shellycoat has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide while at least partially submerged in water.

fields.name: Absorb Flesh
fields.desc: When the shoggoth kills a creature while within 15 feet of it, the creature’s body is absorbed into the shoggoth’s. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The shoggoth can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Anaerobic Nature
fields.desc: The shoggoth doesn’t require air.

fields.name: Hideous Cacophony
fields.desc: The shoggoth’s many mouths constantly emit whistles, fluting, and other high-pitched noises. It has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to be unheard. Each creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the shoggoth and that can hear it must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or be disoriented until the start of its next turn. A disoriented creature is incapacitated, and when it moves, it moves in a random direction.

fields.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The shoggoth has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

fields.name: Limited Mutability
fields.desc: Any spell or effect that would alter the shoggoth’s form alters it for only 1 round. Afterward, the shoggoth returns to its amorphous blob form.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The shroud can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Shadow Evolution
fields.desc: If the shroud deals at least 12 necrotic damage to a creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead in 1 minute or less, the shroud transforms into a shadow at the start of the turn after it last dealt damage. It uses the statistics of the shadow, except it reduces the shadow’s hp by an amount equal to the damage the shroud took before it transformed.

fields.name: Sunlight Weakness
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the shroud has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The shroud doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Fate’s Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the skein witch fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The skein witch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Echolocation
fields.desc: The skin bat can’t use its blindsight while deafened.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: The skin bat doesn’t require air or sleep.

fields.name: Broken Shell
fields.desc: A creature that hits the skitterhaunt with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The skitterhaunt doesn’t require sleep.

fields.name: Vermin Encasement
fields.desc: The creature within the vermin’s shell is a shapeless ooze protected by the vermin’s exoskeleton. When the skitterhaunt is reduced to 0 hp, the exoskeleton breaks, and the skitterhaunt ooze exits it. Once out of its exoskeleton, the ooze is Small, has an AC of 10, 10 hp, and a speed of 15 feet, and it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, its only attack is a Slam that uses the same statistics as its Sting, except it deals bludgeoning damage instead of piercing damage. The skitterhaunt dies if it remains outside of a host for more than 24 hours. It can exit or enter a dead host’s exoskeleton as a bonus action.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The slow storm doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Eye of the Storm
fields.desc: The slow storm is surrounded by a 15-foot-radius wind storm. The storm imposes disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks based on sight or hearing within the area. The winds extinguish open flames and disperse fog. A flying creature in the storm must land at the end of its turn or fall. Each creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 9 (2d8) lightning damage. The storm’s area is difficult terrain for any creature other than the slow storm.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The golem doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Enchanted Weapons
fields.desc: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical. When the golem hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 5d8 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Vessel
fields.desc: When the smaragdine golem counters or ends a spell with Absorb Spell, it holds the spell’s magical energy within its body and becomes Charged for 1 minute. While Charged, the golem sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

fields.name: Ice Climb
fields.desc: When climbing on ice, the Snow Queen has a climbing speed of 20 feet, and she can climb difficult surfaces made of ice and snow, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Icy Weapons
fields.desc: The Snow Queen’s weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 cold damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the Snow Queen fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Snow Walk
fields.desc: The Snow Queen can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost her extra movement.

fields.name: Snowsight
fields.desc: The Snow Queen can see through areas obscured by snowfall, sleet, rain, and other wintry precipitation without penalty.

fields.name: Divine Weapons
fields.desc: The son of Fenris’s weapon attacks are magical. When the son hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d6 necrotic damage or radiant damage (included in the attack), the son’s choice.

fields.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The son of Fenris has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The soul eater has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Soul Sense
fields.desc: The soul eater can pinpoint the location of creatures that have souls within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The spark doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Command Vermin
fields.desc: The spawn of Akyishigal can command any Beast with an Intelligence of 2 or lower within 30 feet of it that isn’t under the magical control of another creature, provided the Beast is insectoid and doesn’t have a Challenge Rating higher than the spawn’s. The Beast obeys the spawn’s commands to the best of its ability, heedless of its own safety.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The spawn of Akyishigal has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Devil’s Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the spawn’s darkvision.

fields.name: Hive Bond
fields.desc: While the spawn is within 60 feet of at least one member of its hive, it has advantage on initiative rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks. The spawn can’t be surprised if at least one other member is aware of the danger and within 300 feet of it.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Speak with Insects
fields.desc: The spawn can communicate with insects as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Disgrace Bound
fields.desc: The spectral guardian is bound to a tomb, castle ruins, or other place related to the disgrace in life that caused it to rise as a spectral guardian in death. If the guardian starts its turn more than 1 mile from its bound location, it loses its Spectral Blade action until it returns to the region. If it remains outside the region, it automatically teleports back to its bound location after 24 hours, regardless of distance.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The spectral guardian can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The spectral guardian doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Eldritch Understanding
fields.desc: The spider of Leng can read and use any spell scroll or magic item, ignoring all class, race, and level requirements.

fields.name: Poisonous Blood
fields.desc: A creature that hits the spider of Leng with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) poison damage.

fields.name: Poisonous Death
fields.desc: When the spider of Leng dies, the poisonous blood in its body vaporizes, forming a cloud in the spider’s space until initiative count 20 on the next round. Each creature within 5 feet of the spider and each creature that enters the cloud for the first time on a turn must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The spider thief doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The spider thief is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The spider thief has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The spinosaurus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

fields.name: Reptilian Affinity
fields.desc: The spinosaurus never willingly attacks a reptilian Humanoid, such as a lizardfolk or dragonborn, unless attacked first. If magically forced to attack such a creature, the spinosaurus has disadvantage on attack rolls against it. This trait doesn’t function if the spinosaurus’s rider or tamer directs it to attack.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The spinosaurus deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Energized Body
fields.desc: A creature wearing metal or wielding a metal weapon that touches the spire walker or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The drake has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Nimbus of Swirling Stars
fields.desc: At the start of each of the drake’s turns, each creature within 10 feet of it and that can see it must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Planar Weapons
fields.desc: The drake’s weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Psychic Absorption
fields.desc: Whenever the star spawn is subjected to psychic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hp equal to the psychic damage dealt.

fields.name: Void Traveler
fields.desc: The star spawn of Cthulhu doesn’t require air, food, drink, sleep, or ambient pressure.

fields.name: Boiler Weakness
fields.desc: If the steam golem starts its turn immersed in water, or if it was soaked with at least 20 gallons of water on its previous turn, it risks losing steam pressure in its boiler. The steam golem must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or its internal fire is extinguished. Until its internal fire is relit, the golem’s speed is halved, its AC is reduced by 2, and it must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On a failure, it stops repeating this saving throw and becomes dormant, effectively dead until the fire is relit. A Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of the golem can take an action to relight the golem’s internal fire, making it active again.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The golem doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Heated Weapons
fields.desc: The steam golem’s weapon attacks are magical. When the golem hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Delight
fields.desc: When a creature within 30 feet of the strife takes psychic damage, the strife gains 5 temporary hp or gains advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn (the strife’s choice).

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The strife can mimic Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 17 Wisdom (Insight) check.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the stryx keeps its beak closed and doesn’t speak, it is indistinguishable from a normal owl.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The stryx doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
fields.desc: The stryx has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

fields.name: Mountain Walk
fields.desc: The stuhac can move across and climb rocky surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of rocks or rocky debris doesn’t cost it extra movement.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The stuhac’s long jump is up to 30 feet and tis high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Flood Fever
fields.desc: During flood season, the subek is overcome with bloodthirsty malice, becoming more aggressive and losing its proficiency in Intelligence (History) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks. If it hasn’t fed within the past 8 hours, it enters a frenzy, spending each turn attacking the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the subek attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. During the frenzy, it has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn’t have all its hp.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The subek can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

fields.name: Detect Lies
fields.desc: The suturefly knows if it hears a lie and can pinpoint the location of a creature within 60 feet of it that lied within the last minute.

fields.name: Forest Camouflage
fields.desc: The suturefly has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in forested terrain.

fields.name: Swamp Camouflage
fields.desc: The swamp adder has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The swarm of fire dancers doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Fire Form
fields.desc: A creature that touches the swarm or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the first time the swarm enters a creature’s space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage and catches fire. Until a creature, which can include the target, uses an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

fields.name: Illumination
fields.desc: The swarm sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light to an additional 30 feet.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny Elemental. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Water Susceptibility
fields.desc: For every 5 feet the swarm moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

fields.name: Limited Magic Immunity
fields.desc: The swarm of manabane scarabs can’t be affected or detected by spells of 2nd level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

fields.name: Sense Magic
fields.desc: The swarm of manabane scarabs senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn’t itself magical.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Glittering Carapace
fields.desc: When a creature that can see the swarm starts its turn within 30 feet of the swarm and the swarm is in bright or dim light, the swarm can force the creature to make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw if the swarm isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature falls unconscious. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save is incapacitated and its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn, as it remains transfixed in place by the glitter of the swarm. A creature has advantage on the saving throw if the swarm is in dim light.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Sunlight Weakness
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the swarm of sluaghs has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny fey. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The swarm of wharflings can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Snapping Jaws
fields.desc: A creature that attempts to move out of or through the swarm of wharflings must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny wharfling. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The swarm of wolf spirits can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The swarm of wolf spirits doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The temple dog has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Protector’s Instincts
fields.desc: The temple dog has advantage on initiative rolls while in its temple or within 30 feet of a priest of its deity.

fields.name: Radiant Jaws
fields.desc: The temple dog’s Bite attacks are magical. When it hits with a Bite attack, the Bite deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Rushing Bite
fields.desc: If the temple dog moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the temple dog. If the target is pushed, the temple dog can move up to 10 feet straight toward the target without provoking opportunity attacks.

fields.name: Green Regeneration
fields.desc: While in a forest, the tendril puppet regains 5 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The tendril puppet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Root Mind
fields.desc: The vine lord and the tendril puppets it has created are connected via a hive mind. The vine lord and its puppets can telepathically communicate with each other, provided the communicating creatures are within 1 mile of each other. In addition, while in a forest, the tendril puppet can’t be [rule]surprise;surprised[/condition].

fields.name: Woodland Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of nonmagical plants doesn’t cost the tendril puppet extra movement, and it can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

fields.name: Chilling Presence
fields.desc: At the start of each of the thuellai’s turns, each creature within 15 feet of it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) cold damage. For each minute a creature spends within 15 feet of the thuellai, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion from cold exposure. Unprotected, nonmagical flames within 15 feet of the thuellai are extinguished. Any spells of 3rd level or lower that provide resistance to cold damage and that are within 15 feet of the thuellai immediately end. Water freezes if it remains within 15 feet of the thuellai for at least 1 minute.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The thuellai doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Snowsight
fields.desc: The thuellai can see through areas obscured by snowfall, sleet, rain, and other wintry precipitation without penalty.

fields.name: Cast Iron Stomach
fields.desc: The thursir has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

fields.name: Slither
fields.desc: If the titanoboa hasn’t eaten a Huge creature in the last 24 hours, it can easily move through any open large enough for a Large creature, and it can squeeze through any opening large enough for a Medium creature. The titanoboa’s destination must still have suitable room to accommodate its volume.

fields.name: Sparkling Scales
fields.desc: When a creature that can see the titanoboa starts its turn within 30 feet of the titanoboa and the titanoboa is in bright light, isn’t incapacitated, and can see the creature, the titanoboa can force the creature to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Burning Heart
fields.desc: The tophet sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Each creature in the bright light has resistance to cold damage. At the start of each of its turns, the tophet chooses whether this light is active.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The tophet doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Heated Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the tophet or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Crowd Tactics
fields.desc: The tosculi can share its space with up to one other tosculi. While sharing its space with one other tosculi, it has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if the other tosculi in its space isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Glide
fields.desc: The tosculi can extend its vestigial wings while falling to slow its rate of descent to 60 feet per round, landing on its feet and taking no falling damage. It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it falls. The tosculi can’t gain height with its wings alone. If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.

fields.name: Hive Sense
fields.desc: The tosculi can pinpoint the location of its hive queen when she is within 300 feet of it, and it can sense the general direction and distance to the hive where its queen makes her home.

fields.name: Archer
fields.desc: A ranged weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the tosculi hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Hive Sense
fields.desc: The tosculi can pinpoint the location of its hive queen when she is within 300 feet of it, and it can sense the general direction and distance to the hive where its queen makes her home.

fields.name: Point Blank Hunter
fields.desc: When the tosculi makes a ranged attack with a bow, it doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, though it may still have disadvantage from other sources.

fields.name: Hive’s Heart
fields.desc: The hive queen knows the direction and distance to all members of her hive and the range of her telepathy extends to 20 miles when communicating with a member of her hive.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the hive queen fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Crowd Tactics
fields.desc: The tosculi can share its space with up to one other tosculi. While sharing its space with one other tosculi, it has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if the other tosculi in its space isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Hive Sense
fields.desc: The tosculi can pinpoint the location of its hive queen when she is within 300 feet of it, and it can sense the general direction and distance to the hive where its queen makes her home.

fields.name: Improvised Tools
fields.desc: The kobold trapsmith can use any Tiny objects at hand to pick locks and disarm traps, as if any such object was part of a set of thieves’ tools. It is proficient in using Tiny objects in this way. In addition, the trapsmith has advantage on ability checks to pick locks and disarm traps.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The kobold trapsmith has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the trapsmith’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold trapsmith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The treacle can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The treacle can mimic animal sounds. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The trollkin reaver regains 5 hp at the start of its turn. If the trollkin takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the trollkin’s next turn. The trollkin dies if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Thick Hide
fields.desc: The trollkin reaver’s skin is thick and tough, granting it a +1 bonus to Armor Class. This bonus is already factored into the trollkin’s AC.

fields.name: Electrified Tendrils
fields.desc: A creature that touches the skyfish or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) lightning damage. In addition, a creature that starts its turn beneath the skyfish while the skyfish is hovering takes 3 (1d6) lightning damage, provided the creature is within 15 feet of the skyfish.

fields.name: Mobile Grappler
fields.desc: While grappling a creature, the tusked skyfish can move at its full speed, carrying the grappled creature along with it.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The umbral vampire can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the umbral vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The umbral vampire doesn’t require air.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The uraeus doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The uraeus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Mind-Rending Death
fields.desc: When the urochar dies, it releases all the fear it consumed in its lifetime in a single, mind-rending wave. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

fields.name: Rubbery Body
fields.desc: The urochar’s body is rubbery with few bones, allowing it to easily move through any opening large enough for a Medium creature. It can squeeze through any opening large enough for a Small creature. The urochar’s destination must still have suitable room to accommodate its volume.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The urochar can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The ushabti doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the ushabti is motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal funerary statue.

fields.name: Healing Leech
fields.desc: If a creature within 30 feet of the ushabti regains hp from a spell or magical effect, the creature regains only half the amount and the ushabti regains the other half.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The ushabti is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the ushabti fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The ushabti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Necrotic Weapons
fields.desc: The ushabti’s weapon attacks are magical. When the ushabti hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The ushabti doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the ushabti is motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal funerary statue.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The ushabti is immune to spells and effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The ushabti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Necrotic Weapons
fields.desc: The ushabti’s weapon attacks are magical. When the ushabti hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Aura of Valor
fields.desc: Friendly creatures wielding weapons within 30 feet of the valkyrie have advantage on weapon attack rolls and ability checks. At the start of each of its turns, the valkyrie can choose to exclude any number of friendly creatures from this aura (no action required).

fields.name: Immortal Nature
fields.desc: The valkyrie doesn’t require food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The valkyrie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Radiant Weapons
fields.desc: The valkyrie’s weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 16 (3d10) radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Fog Flow
fields.desc: While in fog or mist, the vapor lynx can move through a space as narrow at 1 inch wide without squeezing, provided the fog or mist is flowing through the space.

fields.name: Hazesight
fields.desc: The vapor lynx can see through areas obscured by fog, mist, and steam without penalty.

fields.name: Swamp Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of mud, shallow water, and water plants doesn’t cost the vapor lynx extra movement.

fields.name: Toxic Smoke
fields.desc: If the venomous mummy takes fire damage, each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw as its venom-soaked wraps emit a poisonous smoke. On a failure, a creature takes 7 (2d6) poison damage and is poisoned until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t poisoned. The smoke fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the mummy. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts until the end of the mummy’s next turn. A creature that enters the cloud for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there is poisoned until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The venomous mummy doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Venom-Soaked Wraps
fields.desc: A creature that touches the mummy or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) poison damage.

fields.name: Oasis Appearance
fields.desc: While the vesiculosa remains motionless and partially submerged on the surface of sand or soil, it is indistinguishable from a small oasis or pond. The vesiculosa’s pitcher produces enough water for plants to grow around it, provided the vesiculosa remains in the area for an extended period of time. A creature that eats a fruit from a plant growing in the vesiculosa’s water is affected by the Sweet Water trait as if it drank the water.

fields.name: Sweet Fragrance
fields.desc: When a creature that can smell the vesiculosa’s sweet fragrance starts its turn within 30 feet of the vesiculosa, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 1 minute. While charmed, the creature must move on its turn toward the vesiculosa by the safest available route to get within 5 feet of the plant and drink its water. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the vesiculosa’s Sweet Fragrance for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: Sweet Water
fields.desc: A creature that drinks water from the vesiculosa’s pitcher regains 5 (2d4) hp, reduces its exhaustion level by 1, and must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. An unconscious creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake. Drinking the water provides a creature enough nourishment to sustain it for one day.

fields.name: Forest’s Defender
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of nonmagical plants doesn’t cost the vila extra movement, and it can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard. In addition, while in forested terrain, the vila has advantage on initiative rolls.

fields.name: Poisoned Weapons
fields.desc: The vila’s weapons are coated with a magical poison harvest from the forest. When the vila hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 poison damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Speak with Beasts
fields.desc: The vila can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Blood Frenzy
fields.desc: The vile barber has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn’t have all its hp.

fields.name: Green Regeneration
fields.desc: While in a forest, the vine lord regains 10 hp at the start of its turn if it hast at least 1 hp.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The vine lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Root Mind
fields.desc: The vine lord and the tendril puppets it has created are connected via a hive mind. The vine lord and its puppets can telepathically communicate with each other, provided the communicating creatures are within 1 mile of each other. In addition, while in a forest, the vine lord can’t be surprised.

fields.name: Vine Seed
fields.desc: A creature infected with a vine lord’s vine seed suffers near-constant pain as the seed takes root and spreads tendrils throughout its body. For the first 24 hours after infection, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, as the pain from the spreading roots distracts it. Then, the seed becomes a disease, devouring the creature from the inside as it grows vines throughout the creature’s body. Until the disease is cured, the infected creature can’t regain hp, and its hp maximum decreases by 7 (2d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if this disease reduces its hp maximum to 0.

fields.name: Woodland Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of plants doesn’t cost the vine lord extra movement. In addition, it can pass through plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The vine troll skeleton regains 5 hp at the start of its turn. If the skeleton takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the skeleton’s next turn. The skeleton dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate or if its bound tree is destroyed (see Tree Bound trait).

fields.name: Tree Bound
fields.desc: The vine troll skeleton is magically bound to a duskthorn dryad, tree, or treant, and the skeleton must stay within 1 mile of it. If the skeleton’s bound duskthorn dryad, tree, or treant dies, the skeleton is immediately destroyed and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The vine troll skeleton doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Chill of the Void
fields.desc: Creatures with resistance to cold damage don’t have resistance to the cold damage dealt by the Void dragon. A creature with immunity to cold damage is still immune to the dragon’s cold damage.

fields.name: Expert Void Traveler
fields.desc: The Void dragon doesn’t require air, food, drink, sleep, or ambient pressure. While traveling in the Void, the dragon magically glides on solar winds, covering immense distances in short times.

fields.name: Darkness Regeneration
fields.desc: While in an area of dim light or darkness, the voidling regains 5 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The voidling has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Void Traveler
fields.desc: The voidling doesn’t require air, food, drink, sleep, or ambient pressure.

fields.name: Glide
fields.desc: The volguloth has draping skin that it can expand while falling to slow its rate of descent to 60 feet per round, landing on its feet and taking no falling damage. It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it falls. The volguloth can’t gain height with its expanded skin alone. If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The volguloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Poisoned Weapons
fields.desc: The volguloth’s weapons are coated with a magical poison. When the volguloth hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 poison damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Grave Goods Sense
fields.desc: The vættir can pinpoint the location of creatures wearing or carrying one of the vættir’s personal items or grave goods within 60 feet of it, and the vættir can sense the general direction of its personal items and grave goods within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Rejuvenation
fields.desc: A destroyed vættir gains a new body in 24 hours, regaining all its hp and becoming active again. The new body forms in a random unoccupied space within 100 feet of where it fell. This trait doesn’t function if the vættir is put to rest (typically by returning its remains to its burial mound).

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the vættir has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The vættir doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Divine Animosity
fields.desc: The wampus cat has advantage on attack rolls against creatures wielding divine or celestial power, such as clerics, paladins, or aasimars.

fields.name: Leaping Pounce
fields.desc: If the war ostrich jumps at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the ostrich can make one Beak attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The war ostrich’s long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The water leaper can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Underwater Camouflage
fields.desc: The water leaper has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The weeping treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Speak with Plants
fields.desc: The weeping treant can communicate with plants as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Weep Acid
fields.desc: Thick tears of dark, acidic sap stream continuously down the treant’s face and trunk. A creature that touches the weeping treant or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3 (1d6) acid damage.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The wharfling can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Arcane Wasting
fields.desc: Characterized by the slow mental deterioration it causes, arcane wasting is a disease that infects Humanoids and spreads through spellcasting. A creature infected with this disease manifests symptoms 1d4 days after infection, which include brain fog and difficulty recalling memories. Until the disease is cured, at the end of each long rest, the infected creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its Intelligence and Wisdom scores are each reduced by 1d2. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest after the disease is cured. If the disease reduces a creature’s Intelligence or Wisdom to 0, the creature dies. If the infected creature casts a spell on a Humanoid before the disease is cured, and the Humanoid is hit by the spell or fails the saving throw, that Humanoid must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or also become infected with the arcane wasting disease.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The white ape has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Spellcasting Animosity
fields.desc: If the white ape sees a creature cast a spell, the ape has advantage on attack rolls against that creature on the ape’s next turn.

fields.name: Elusive
fields.desc: The dragon has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape an effect that would reduce its speed or grapple or restrain it.

fields.name: Storm Sight
fields.desc: The dragon can see through areas obscured by fog, mist, clouds, or precipitation.

fields.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
fields.desc: The witchlight is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the witchlight must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster’s spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The witchlight doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Variable Illumination
fields.desc: The witchlight sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The witchlight can alter the radius as a bonus action.

fields.name: Danger Sense
fields.desc: While conscious, the wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

fields.name: Dwarven Resilience
fields.desc: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the dwarf’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

fields.name: Reckless
fields.desc: At the start of its turn, the wolf reaver dwarf can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The wormhearted suffragan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Master of Undeath
fields.desc: A Humanoid killed by the wormhearted suffragan’s disease rises 1d4 hours later as a skeleton or zombie (the suffragan’s choice), unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. Between its disease and its Animating Worms, the suffragan can have no more than fifteen total skeletons and zombies under its control at one time.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The wormhearted suffragan doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Absorb
fields.desc: Any nonmagical object that touches the xanka’s central globe, any nonmagical weapon that hits the xanka, or any nonmagical object, structure, or creature hit by the xanka’s Dismantling Leg attack begins to deteriorate. If it is a structure or an object that isn’t being worn or carried, up to a 1-foot cube of the structure or object is destroyed. If it is an object worn or carried by a creature, the creature must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the item being affected by the xanka’s Absorb.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The xanka doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Corruption’s Bond
fields.desc: The xhkarsh ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature whose fate it has corrupted. In addition, it can pinpoint the location of any such creature, as well as sense the creature’s general state of health. These effects function even if the xhkarsh and the creature are on different planes of existence.

fields.name: Interdimensional Nature
fields.desc: The xhkarsh doesn’t require air, food, drink, sleep, or ambient pressure.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The ychen bannog deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Darkness Shroud
fields.desc: The cave dragon naturally suppresses light near it. Bright light within 30 feet of the dragon becomes dim light, and dim light within 30 feet becomes nonmagical darkness. If this shroud overlaps bright light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

fields.name: Magical Tunneler
fields.desc: The cave dragon can burrow through nonmagical unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dragon can choose whether to leave the material it moves through undisturbed or leave a 5-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: Spiked Climb
fields.desc: The dragon uses its spikes to hold itself in place while climbing, allowing it to climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. If it climbs upside down on a ceiling or suspends itself on a vertical surface while leaving its claws free, it can’t use the Ruff Spikes reaction.

fields.name: Fire Incarnate
fields.desc: Creatures with resistance to fire damage don’t have resistance to the fire damage dealt by the flame dragon. A creature with immunity to fire damage is still immune to the dragon’s fire damage.

fields.name: Heated Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the flame dragon or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The spinosaurus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

fields.name: Reptilian Affinity
fields.desc: The spinosaurus never willingly attacks a reptilian Humanoid, such as a lizardfolk or dragonborn, unless attacked first. If magically forced to attack such a creature, the spinosaurus has disadvantage on attack rolls against it. This trait doesn’t function if the spinosaurus’s rider or tamer directs it to attack.

fields.name: Chill of the Void
fields.desc: Creatures with resistance to cold damage don’t have resistance to the cold damage dealt by the Void dragon. A creature with immunity to cold damage is still immune to the dragon’s cold damage.

fields.name: Expert Void Traveler
fields.desc: The Void dragon doesn’t require air, food, drink, sleep, or ambient pressure. While traveling in the Void, the dragon magically glides on solar winds, covering immense distances in short times.

fields.name: Elusive
fields.desc: The dragon has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape an effect that would reduce its speed or grapple or restrain it.

fields.name: Storm Sight
fields.desc: The dragon can see through areas obscured by fog, mist, clouds, or precipitation.

fields.name: Desperate Hunger
fields.desc: When the zimwi is below half its hp maximum, it has advantage on melee attack rolls against creatures that aren’t Constructs.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The zmey headling can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: As the zmey, but it regains only 10 hp at the start of its turn.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The zmey can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the zmey fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The zmey regains 15 hp at the start of its turn. If the zmey takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the zmey’s next turn. The zmey dies if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

fields.name: Three Heads
fields.desc: The zmey has three heads. While it has more than one head, the zmey has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious. Whenever the zmey takes 40 damage or more in a single turn, one of its heads is severed. If it has only one head remaining, dealing 40 damage or more to it doesn’t sever the final head. It regrows any severed heads when it finishes a long rest.
